story:
Short Summary

My name is Umeshi Rajeendra and I am a dance teacher and choreographer living in Sri Lanka. I have recently been accepted into the MFA Dance Program at The University of the Arts – which I’m very excited about.  This fundraiser is an appeal to you for help with my tuition fees so I can pursue this very valuable opportunity and help my students and the community in Sri Lanka. 

My Background 

To give you a brief background of my experience - I founded the Mesh Academy of Dance in Sri Lanka in 2015 after completing my BA at Denison University. To my surprise, the school took off and I have been able to transform the Sri Lankan dance industry more than I could have dreamed of. I trained dancers with little to no experience in dance to perform in four of my choreographed productions and have been a visiting lecturer at two of Sri Lanka’s top universities for performing arts, where I am helping to develop the contemporary dance program for undergraduate students. I have also been pushing the subject of reimagining dance in the public sphere in Sri Lanka and was a TEDx Speaker in 2015.

I have also kept my ties with the US, doing a collaborative project with Denison University over the past 3 years where dancers from both Denison and my academy do a two-week exchange program to get exposed to the different cultures and dance methodologies. Furthermore, I received a scholarship to attend the American Dance Festival as an International Choreographer in Residence where I presented my work in progress choreography in 2016.

For reviews of my work and more information on me, please click on below links:

1. http://www.sundaytimes.lk/190421/magazine/left-...

2. http://www.sundaytimes.lk/170423/magazine/comin...

3. http://www.life.lk/article/buzz_with_danu/Buzz-...

4. https://roar.media/english/life/culture-identit... 

 

I ask of your help to get me to the University of the Arts in September 2019

I am passionate about using my creative voice to impact society and generating multiple ideas and solutions with an experimental approach. With the education provided at The University of the Arts, I can broaden and deepen my dance skills and refine my own craft so that I can continue to shape the dance community in Sri Lanka and challenge existing thinking.  The curriculum, which is grounded in critical inquiry and creative practice, will enable me to transcend artistic disciplines and forge partnerships with different artists locally and globally.

While I am eternally grateful to the university for offering me a scholarship of 80% toward my education, the $10,000 balance is preventing me from attending at this point in time due to the challenges I face in Sri Lanka. Sri Lanka does not provide financial and social support for artists, and public and private scholarship opportunities are practically non-existent.  In addition, banks in Sri Lanka do not give loans to artists as it’s not a recognized industry. Unfortunately, as an artist, we do not earn much, and building up my school in the last 4 years means a majority of the fees goes back into the school for my student's development, therefore I am finding it difficult to find the means to make this happen. 

I am aware that not every dancer has been afforded the opportunities that I have been so blessed with. I would like to restate my commitment to support aspiring young dancers by means of teaching, advice based on my own experience and also financially when I am able to do so.

As an emerging artist I have so much more to learn and discover. Having this opportunity to spend time side by side with prominent professors of Contemporary Dance will prove pivotal in extending my skills in choreography and teaching, to help my dancers in Sri Lanka develop their own art, more attuned to the global context. Therefore, I am kindly requesting you to help me so that I can pursue my MFA and continue to give back to my country and give my students a better dance education. The MFA in Dance at the University of the Arts is one of the best programs out there and it would be a privilege for me to attend and eventually, establish a long term partnership. 

What We Need & What You Get

If any of the above resonates with you please help me! Any donation is helpful, and also feel free to contact me. $10,000 go directly towards my tuition fees. I am doing several workshops in Sri Lanka to raise funds for my airfare, accommodation, and meals, therefore this campaign is purely for my tuition. 

I understand that not everyone is able to help support me financially, so if you can’t, I would hugely appreciate it if you shared my page with your friends and family on social media/emails/word of mouth. I will be sure to update you regularly on my progress throughout next year’s study.  

Impact 

I believe the Master of Fine Arts in Dance at the University of Arts is the perfect institution that will cultivate my inspired identity and spirited-groundwork from the past few years, in an environment that will serve to broaden my skills through exposure to current creative practices and research in choreography. This next phase of my creative pursuits will provide the injection that my students and the community at large in Sri Lanka needs to propel the momentum I have created in the last few years in my motherland. This will help me establish stronger programs in high schools and in the University. This will also help me establish a long term partnership whereby my students are able to go and experience training firsthand internationally. 

Other than my endless gratitude I can offer every single skill or thing I have acquired so far.
Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to hearing from you.

story:
Why Should You Care?

  • Do you have an opinion on smartphones and social media? Probably. If so this show is for you.
  • Tribe of Fools is going to use comedy and acrobatics to examine (and poke a little fun at) the way we think about technology and social media and its effect on our lives.
  • Fishtown is an artistic stretch of Tribe of Fools' signature physical style into a dancier, more sensual feel.
  • Not familiar with our style? Click here for some past examples. 

What Do We Need?

  • We're passionate about bringing Philadelphia audiences AFFORDABLE performances that include daring physical stunts live on stage. Past examples look like this or This or THIS. 
  • In order to do this we need to hire performers who are great actors and TRAIN them to also be acrobats AND we need professional designers to build sturdy, safe sets that we can fly into, around and off of. In order to do this we need to raise $10,000 by September 4th! 

How You Can Help!

Tribe of Fools wants to keep ticket prices low so that people in Philadelphia and New Jersey of all economic means can see our shows. With a donation of $25, $50 or $100, you are ensuring that anyone in Philadelphia can enjoy dynamic and physically daring theatre for an affordable price!

Can't Donate? 

Every little bit helps. Even $5 can make a big difference when many people contribute. However if you just can't do it but you still want to help, SHARE THIS LINK! The next best thing to a donation is sharing this post on Facebook or Twitter!

story:
What is the 12 by 12 Dance Initiative?

12 months. 12 Choreographers. 12 Works.

Produced and curated by Arielle Petruzzella and Robert Mark Burke, the 12 by 12 Dance Initiative is a new choreographic endeavor that is looking to create community of working artists where feedback and support are at the forefront of the process. As a culminating celebration, the 12 choreographers will present their new works in an immersive performance event.

The 12 Artists of 2014 are:

Robert Mark Burke (January); Arielle Petruzzella (February); Colleen Pictor (March); Myssi Robinson (April); Robert Foerster (May); Scott Schneider (June); Alyssa Derling (July); Meagan Woods (August); Monica Gonzalez (September); Elizabeth Zwierzynski (October); Sarah Lifson (November); Molly Galbraith (December)

Each month, the designated artist post about their process on the 12 by 12 Dance Initiative Facebook Page:

www.facebook.com/12by12dance

Help Build A Community

While funding from our campaign will go directly to support our final performance (venue, promotions, etc.), you will be helping to fuel a new generation of emerging artists by supporting our process and commitment to create strong, artistic work that pushes the boundaries of movement and art.  One successful performance funded by you can help launch a lifetime of opportunity for young artists to follow!

Become a Part of Our Community!

Any donation is greatly appreciated and welcomed but we understand that sometimes it is just not possible! That's ok! Get involved with us in these other ways:

1. Volunteer for the event: Email 12by12danceinitiative@gmail.com to find out how you can help out at our final performance.

2. Share our Campaign: Go ahead and share this to your friends and family members that you think might be interested!

3. Like our Facebook Page:  Follow the artiist ion Face book (www.facebook.com/12by12dance) and share the page with your friends!

THANK YOU IN ADVANCED FROM ALL OF US AT 12 BY 12 DANCE!! YOUR SUPPORT IS GREATLY APPRECIATED!


ANY QUESTIONS?? FEEL FREE TO EMAIL US AT 12BY12DANCEINITIATIVE@GMAIL.COM

story:
THE TRIP invites you to join our group therapy session. Bitter coffee, cheap orange juice, and day-old cookies will be provided. Mac doesn’t want to engage this way, in this compulsive act of stealing someone’s life. He’d rather be bird-watching. But he can’t help himself. From within the safety of a theatrical twelve-step meeting, THE TRIP invites you to experience Shakespeare’s MACBETH in a way you’ve never imagined it.

After the unsuccessful attempt to raise the amount of money required for a very ambitious adaptation of Ernest Hemingway’s “The Snows of Kilimanjaro,” THE TRIP is back with a more modestly budgeted and conceived production. We will be making this show for practically nothing. It will be a shoestring budget, a labor of love. We are making this show to share it with the world, to continue to support our collaborators, and to follow through with the promise to our backers to make the kind of theater that only THE TRIP makes. Joshua Brody, Carissa Cash, Claire Kaplan, and Thomas Miller will all still be featured in the piece and it will be directed by Tom Dugdale.

The total cost of the show will be a little over $5000. We have pledged $1400 out of our own pockets—the absolute maximum we can spare—and we are hoping for your help with the remaining $3600.  We have tightened the budget everywhere we can.  Our actors have agreed to a significant reduction in pay, and we will be working for free.  But we cannot avoid the cost of space rental, insurance, and a few indispensable design elements (like seating for our audience!).  These are the areas where your contribution will be applied.

As always, you can support us in three ways:

1. DONATE HERE! Every dollar counts and we need a few of them.

2. SPREAD THE WORD! Social media, email, word of mouth, smoke signals. Whatever it takes to get the word out.

3. COME SEE THE SHOW! We want to share it with you. That's the whole point.


As always, we hope you'll do all three. 

Thank you once again and always for your support of THE TRIP’s efforts to make innovative and exciting theater.

 Yours,

THE TRIP

(Tom & Josh)


UPDATE: We have reached our funding goal!! Thank you so, so very much to all of you who already donated! A few expenses in the project have turned out to be a little more than we expected, so we're going to keep trying to raise money on here until the time runs out! Rest assured, every dollar goes directly into production costs. We have signed the rental agreement with the space. And as exciting as that is (and trust us, it IS!), it also required that a lot of spending happen before we ever collected the money from this campaign. So we're hoping to continue to go, go, go above and beyond the goal in an effort to defray the costs. Thank you so much again, and help us continue to spread the word!


And here's another UPDATE, from Tom:

Dear Friends,

Writing you from the air on my way from San Diego to Germany. I'm traveling a day (and staying just two) to see my favorite company in the world, NEEDCOMPANY. Several years ago while still a student, I saw an epic production of theirs that was and still is the greatest thing I have ever seen. It changed my life.

Why share this? Only to say: This is theater. In some special circumstances, when the right group of people are gathered in the right place, something can be made which hooks us and keeps us hooked, so much so that we save for months to fly half-way around the world to see it live. Despite all our technologies, it's still that group of earnest Ernies right in front of us in Frankfurt or San Diego singing a goofy song (if it's one of my shows) which moves us in the way the say: We are here in this moment, and it's a good moment. 

We hope with this next show and all we do that we are a good moment for you, and we can't thank you enough for your support. You are helping us come together. And if you want to get on a plane and join us, you better believe we'll be waiting here with a big hug... and a big show.

Love,

Tom

story:
Matching Grant!

Help us make this tour of "Frank Olivier's TWISTED CABARET Comedy Show" a reality!  We now have a dollar for dollar matching grant, three of the four theaters lined up, and lots of our ducks in a row. With your help this whole tour will take off, and you'll be part of what made it happen. I'd love to include your name among our sponsors.

Greetings! 

I'm Frank Olivier, and if you're not familiar with my work, you may have seen me doing my comedy act on The Tonight Show, America's Got Talent, Ellen, HBO's Just for Laughs, Comic Strip Live, and almost 100 other shows. I'm also among the most multi-skilled variety artists in America today: Juggling, magic, unicycling, knife throwing, guitar playing, sword swallowing, stilt walking, fire eating, and of course, comedy.

What We're Creating:

The theater show we're planning to tour: "Frank Olivier's TWISTED CABARET Comedy Show" is a culmination of 40 years of training in the variety arts, combined with my comedy skills, and offbeat sense of humor. This two month tour will include Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, and Los Angeles in 250 - 500 seat houses.

Our Twisted History

Twisted Cabaret first opened in San Francisco  for four months, in 2002. Since then we've played numerous times in The San Francisco Bay Area, Northern California, San Diego, Los Angeles, Las Vegas (Sahara & Rio), and for 7 years running at England's Glastonbury Festival. The show keeps evolving and getting funnier as we hone old acts, and create new ones.

Where it all will go:

This total amount will cover our hard expenses for the tour:

  • None of this funding will go directly to me. My entire pay, and much of my staff's pay will come through ticket sales
  • If we fail to reach our fundraising goal, the show will go on, but production values may need to be scaled down, and we may have to lose the live band
  • Any funds above our actual operating expenses will help send us to the Edinburgh Festival in Scotland in August 2015!

And Your Contribution is Tax Deductible!

We're partnered with San Francisco's "Climate Theater", a non-profit 510(c)(3), dedicated to producing live theater. This allows us to collect money through Indiegogo's non-profit wing.

The Impact

If this gets funded we have created magic together. A tour of this scope is beyond the risk I can take on personally, but it's sheer magic what can be done together, through crowd sourcing.

  • We'll delight thousands of people
  • Keep ticket prices affordable
  • Keep the seats filled
  • Have a blast, doing routines too offbeat for the corporate shows I do for much of the rest of the year

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? You can still get on board!:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign & the show!
  • Share this on Facebook, email to friends who may be up for supporting this
  • Volunteer! Before we start, and long the tour there are numerous ways to get involved and see the show: Ushers, backstage food, ticket takers, plus tech help

Greetings! 
I'm Frank Olivier, and if you're not familiar with my work, you may have seen me doing my comedy act on The Tonight Show, America's Got Talent, Ellen, HBO's Just for Laughs, Comic Strip Live, and almost 100 other shows. I'm also among the most multi-skilled variety artists in America today: Juggling, magic, unicycling, knife throwing, guitar playing, sword swallowing, stilt walking, fire eating, and of course, comedy.

What We're Creating:
The theater show we're planning to tour: "Frank Olivier's TWISTED CABARET Comedy Show" is a culmination of 40 years of training in the variety arts, combined with my comedy skills, and offbeat sense of humor. This two month tour will include Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, and Los Angeles in 250 - 500 seat houses.Our Twisted History
Twisted Cabaret first opened in San Francisco  for four months, in 2002. Since then we've played numerous times in The San Francisco Bay Area, Northern California, San Diego, Los Angeles, Las Vegas (Sahara & Rio), and for 7 years running at England's Glastonbury Festival. The show keeps evolving and getting funnier as we hone old acts, and create new ones.
  Where it all will go:
This total amount will cover our hard expenses for the tour: 




None of this funding will go directly to me. My entire pay, and much of my staff's pay will come through ticket sales
If we fail to reach our fundraising goal, the show will go on, but production values may need to be scaled down, and we may have to lose the live band

Any funds above our actual operating expenses will help send us to the Edinburgh Festival in Scotland in August 2015!


And Your Contribution is Tax Deductible! We're partnered with San Francisco's "Climate Theater", a non-profit 510(c)(3), dedicated to producing live theater. This allows us to collect money through Indiegogo's non-profit wing.

  The Impact If this gets funded we have created magic together. A tour of this scope is beyond the risk I can take on personally, but it's sheer magic what can be done together, through crowd sourcing.  We'll delight thousands of people
 Keep ticket prices affordable
Keep the seats filled
Have a blast, doing routines too offbeat for the corporate shows I do for much of the rest of the year







   Other Ways You Can Help Can't contribute financially? You can still get on board!:  Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign & the show! Share this on Facebook, email to friends who may be up for supporting this
Volunteer! Before we start, and long the tour there are numerous ways to get involved and see the show: Ushers, backstage food, ticket takers, plus tech help
campaign_city: Seattle, Portland, S.F. & L.A., United States

story:
Replay Theatre Company is a Belfast-based charity who have been making adventures for younger audiences since 1988.

On Sunday 27th September 2015, we’re creating the world’s first BabyDay – over 70 events in more than 20 venues across the city! 

And then, just six days after BabyDay, our own babyshow TiNY has been invited to be the first ever babyshow in South Africa.  And while we’re there, we’ll work with our partner theatre company in Cape Town, Magnet Theatre, to be part of the development of a homegrown baby theatre movement.  

TiNY will be performed for babies that have just been discharged from the hospital. By that stage their mothers will have been sleeping in chairs or on the floor for days, or even weeks, waiting for the recovery of their babies. When their babies are discharged, these mothers often have to wait a few hours before the paperwork is finalized and this is when they will be offered the opportunity to see the performance.

Please help us take a little bit of Belfast’s BabyDay to the townships of Cape Town to plant a seed there that could grow into something really amazing and help put arts at the heart of the lives of their tiniest citizens.

Belfast to Cape Town is supported by the SA-UK Seasons 2014 & 2015, a partnership between the Department of Arts and Culture, South Africa and the British Council.

story:
Summary

God's Ear by Jenny Schwartz is an imaginative play about the grieving process that breaks the boundaries of theatre.  It floats in a spaceless, timeless atmosphere of loss.The story follows a family in the aftermath of the tragic drowning of their son. The characters try their hardest to reach out to one another, but socially prescribed behaviors and language, meant to help them, never quite do. Though not entirely set in reality, the play is honest and genuine in its exploration of grief. The show will be a movement driven experience in the Caplan Studio Theater at the University of the Arts, April 22nd-30th. 

As artists, we are always looking for the highest amount of creativity and opportunity for ourselves in our work. This play tests the boundaries of language, movement, and design: it is a thrilling challenge for all of our collaborators. God's Ear dives into an exploration of grief  through its frustrating, hilarious, and devastating qualities.  It is a voice to express our inner struggles with social prescriptions for behavior.The show provides an exciting opportunity for us to build a unique theatrical experience, interactive installation, and art gallery.

Recently, our community at the University of the Arts experienced a loss on our campus.  It was during the time director, Shira Berger, lost two other people within the span of three consecutive weeks. God's Ear  suddenly became incredibly relevant to her personally and to the community around her.  The play depicts grief as abstract and ever changing as it is in reality. Students need a way to talk about grief without being told how to do it "right" or how to "move on" quickly. Shira chose this play as her Senior Thesis and quickly developed ways to extend it past herself and into her community. 

 Our team has paired up with other artists at the University of the Arts to compile a Grief Gallery throughout the rehearsal process of the play. The gallery features visual artwork created on the subject of grief and loss. The Grief Gallery is open to any student that wants to contribute work and its curators hold  open art-therapy sessions on various Monday nights until the opening of God's Ear.

Check out how we're reaching into our community at:http://sberger41.wix.com/griefgallery

What We Need & What You Get!

We are looking for $1,100 to help produce this play!

Your contribution will facilitate  the creation of an interactive projection installation, space to showcase work from our community generated Grief Gallery, and expansion of our set. 

PERKS! 

$10- Ripple
One ticket to any performance of God's Ear with a special thank you note from our team!Just let us know the date/time you want to come and attach your e-mail! 

$20- Pool
A postcard version of our poster design and an Original Poem by one of our collaborators! 

$30: River
Two tickets to any performance of God's Ear, a postcard version of our poster design, and a Special Thanks on our website!

$50: Lake 
Two tickets to any performance of God's Ear, a full sized God's Ear poster and a Special Thanks on our website! 

$100: Ocean
A print of an original piece of artwork from our Grief Gallery, a Special Thanks on our website, and a postcard version of our Poster design! Check out the Grief Gallery website: http://sberger41.wix.com/griefgallery

In addition, the rehearsal process will be documented with updates, images, videos, and blogs about our explorations on loss. Your contribution will act as a backstage pass so you can be involved in our discoveries! 

Other Ways You Can Participate

The team of God's Ear, in collaboration with other artists at the University of the Arts, hold art-making nights on various Mondays through April of 2016. Anyone and everyone is welcome to attend these sessions as well as make pieces for the Grief Gallery!   
Submit your art to ecooper@uarts.edu to be documented on our website: http://sberger41.wix.com/griefgallery

Our Collaborators

Shira Berger is a Senior Directing Major at the University of the Arts and is the Director of God's Ear.


Emily Cooper is a Sophomore Directing major at the University of the Arts and is the Assistant Director of God’s Ear. emilyrosecooper.com 


Jeremy Jason studies theatrical lighting and projected media at the University of the Arts  and is on the design team of God’s Ear; making projected magic flow over the captivating world we create.  jjasondesign.com


Bryan Schall is a Junior Directing, Playwrighting, Production major at the University of the Arts and is the lighting designer of the production of God's Ear.


Michael Lambui is a senior Theatre Design and Technology major at the University of the Arts. He is the set designer for the production of God’s Ear.

Shaelyn Weatherup is a Sophomore Theater Design and Technology major at the University of the Arts. She is the props designer for this production of God's Ear. 

 Bailey Roper is a Senior Acting major at the University of the Arts and will be  playing the part of Mel in God's Ear.


Dante Green is a Freshman Musical Theater Major at the University of the Arts and he will be playing the role of Ted.

Alison is a Sophomore Acting Major at The University of the Arts. She will be playing the role of Lanie.

 Lauren is a Junior Acting Major at the University of the Arts and will be playing the role of Lenora. laurencarterreilly.com

Carter Horton is a junior acting major at the University of the Arts and will be playing both Flight Attendant and G.I. Joe.

​Frank Nardi Jr. is a Junior Acting Major at UArts and is playing the role of Guy.

Mia Cefalo is a Freshman Musical Theatre Major and will be playing the role of the Tooth Fairy.

story:
Kaleidoscope Theatre Montreal presents

CAPTAIN AURORA II:

A Superhero Musical Sequel

At the 26th St-Ambroise Montreal Fringe Festival

Created and directed by Trevor Barrette


“Holy tingling anticipation!” - Jim Burke, Montreal Gazette


STORY

Following sold-out performances at the 25th St-Ambroise Montreal Fringe Festival and the 19th Wildside Theatre Festival, the superhero musical saga continues!

In the not too distant future, when the tyrannical President for the Republic of Earth forms an alliance with an extraterrestrial Empress, it will be up to Captain Aurora and her SkyGuard to save the day! But just as Captain Aurora begins to take the reins of the newly founded team, her late fiancé returns from the dead as Talos, a cybernetically enhanced super soldier, causing her plans to go awry. With the fate of the planet at stake, the team must find a way to work together before it is too late. As Captain Aurora says… “where there’s a will, there’s a way!”

Kaleidoscope Theatre Montreal is proud to present its 8th production and 3rd original musical, the sequel to last year’s “smashing success!” (Marilla Steuter-Miller, CJLO): “Captain Aurora II: A Superhero Musical Sequel” created and directed by Trevor Barrette. Now YOU can help us bring this all-new adventure to the stage!


IMPACT

Captain Aurora II is an all-ages (kid-friendly) show that engages with the tropes and narratives of popular superhero fiction. In the sequel, we continue to challenge these ideas while paying tribute to the camp, pizzaz and melodrama of the world of superheroes.

Now in its 5th year, Kaleidoscope Theatre Montreal continues to work with emerging and established artists to produce classic and original works with a focus on dynamic storytelling and design. “We’ve always held collaboration and creation at the heart of our projects,” says founder Trevor Barrette. “That’s why I’m proud to be presenting this project for our 5th birthday. At its core, “Captain Aurora II” is all about friendship and family and working as a team. Although Aurora is certainly at the helm of the ship, the musical is first and foremost an ensemble piece.”


WHAT WE NEED

We're looking to raise 2000$ through this campaign to cover the cost of our costume, set and prop design, in addition to rehearsal space rental and other expenses. Your generous contribution through our Indiegogo campaign will go directly to the printing of posters, postcards as well as books for our 15 actors and music for our 3-piece band, rehearsal space rental (over 100H for the performers and band), the costume design (including 4 new light-up costumes), the set design (including 4 light-up“hoverboards”) and the prop design (including swords, hammers, guns and all sorts of other sci-fi paraphenelia).

All this to bring to you the best superhero musical sequel out there!


WHAT YOU GET

Your support will be rewarded! For every contribution of 7$ or more you’ll receive a perk (or a package of perks) such as:

  • A shout-out on our social media,

  • Character ringtones,

  • Music from the sequel,

  • A digital copy of the book of “Captain Aurora: A Superhero Musical”,

  • Digital costume designs,

  • A rendering of yourself as a member of the Old SkyGuard,

  • An invitation for two to a rehearsal,

  • An onstage cameo and, finally,

  • A performance in your name!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute to our Indiegogo campaign right now, here are three other ways you can help:

1) Follow us on FaceBook (www.fb.com/KaleidoscopeMTL) and Twitter (@KaleidoscopeMTL) and be the first to receive the latest #captainaurora2 news!

2) Share this campaign with your friends and family by e-mail or Facebook and Twitter!

3) Catch a performance of the World Premiere of Captain Aurora II: A Superhero Musical Sequel at Venue 10: LaChapelle Theatre (3700 Rue Saint Dominique, Montréal, QC H2X 2X7): June 09 @ 21:45, 10 @ 18:00, 12 @ 14:30, 16 @ 19:45, 18 @ 22:00 or 19 @ 12:00!


FOR MORE INFORMATION please contact Trevor Barrette at kaleidoscopemtl@hotmail.com.


PRAISE FOR KALEIDOSCOPE THEATRE MONTREAL

Won! 2015 Frankie Award for Most Promising English Company (Segal Centre)

Nominated! 2014 Montreal Arts, Culture and Entertainment Award (Curtains Up)

"Kaleidoscope is a young local company of recent theatre graduates who are really worth watching.” - Anna Fuerstenberg, Rover Arts


PRAISE FOR “CAPTAIN AURORA: A SUPERHERO MUSICAL”

Nominated! 2015 Frankie Award for Best Production (Centaur Theatre)

““Captain Aurora: A Superhero Musical” hits exactly the right chord as this highly professional and fully fleshed out musical comedy sings and dances its way into the Fringe history hall of fame.” - Marilla Steuter-Miller, CJLO

“Well acted, scripted and edited with great songs sung by great singers.” - Sylvain Richard, Culture Plus

“[...] plenty of catchy musical numbers and likeable comic-type characters which put together resulted in an entertaining intergalactic night at the theatre.” - Stuart Nulman, The Montreal Times

“Pop Tart: Top 12 Shows at the 2015 Montreal Fringe Festival” - Richard Burnett, Montreal Gazette

“Byron’s Annual Montreal Fringe Picks... Sight Unseen”- Byron Toben, Mobtreal

“Fringe: L’avant-garde en cinq temps” - Etienne Galarneau, Feu à Volonté

“Coups de coeur 2015 en theatre musicale” - Daniel Ouimet, Info-Culture.biz


TEAM

Book, music and lyrics by Trevor Barrette

Arrangements and orchestrations by David Terriault

Director: Trevor Barrette

Musical directors: Kenny Wong and Luce Belanger

Choreographer: Nadia Verrucci

Fight director: Michelle Lewis

Stage manager: Isabel Quintero Faia

Technical director and set and property designer: Kevin Conforti

Costume and graphic designer: Rachel Quintero Faia

Assistant stage manager and production assistant: Elisabeth DeMedeiros

Lightning designer: Isabel Quintero Faia



CAST

Dawn AKA Captain Aurora: Rosie Callaghan

Selene, her sister: Kendall Savage

Jack, her best friend,  AKA The Green Zinger: David Noel

Frank, former Senator for the Republic of Earth: Kenny Wong

Plug, a Soul-Surfer, founder of the New SkyGuard: Nikki Haggart

Diamond and The Rough, brother and sister duo, former criminals: Vlad Alexis and Saraah Hicks

The Phantom, Plug’s father, founder of the Old SkyGuard: Buck Delaney

President Aria for the Republic of Earth: Nadia Verrucci

Gorganna, an A’aru Cult Leader: Teo Mechetiuc

Doom and Gloom, her acolytes: Corey Tomicic and Matt Lacas

SunBurn, a henchwoman for hire: Michelle Lewis

Talos, a cyborg, Dawn’s late fiance Ben: Zachary Creatchman


THANK YOU!

For more information about Kaleidoscope Theatre Montreal's production of
Captain Aurora II: A Superhero Musical Sequel or the Indiegogo campaign, 
please contact Trevor Barrette at (514) 238-1315 or kaleidoscopemtl@hotmail.com

story:
So What's This All About?

We are LOOP TROUPE, a group of NY based artists presenting our first full-length original comedy, Cult Classic!

Cult Classic follows yoga-guru turned cult-leader Marty, as he struggles to stop his followers from doing the unthinkable.  

Help us bring this timeless tale of hope, delusion, and yoga to Manhattan! 

Our Expenses

Help us reach our goal of $2,500!  It won't pay for everything, but it'll help!

  • Theater Space: Cult Classic will be premiering at the Royal Theatre at the Producers' Club, 358 West 44th Street.
  • Set: Help us turn this theater into "a tent in the middle of nowhere!"
  • Costumes: Hand made costumes from one of our Loop Troupe artists.
  • Props: What do a diamond ring, bolt cutters, and a functioning gong have in common? They're all props we need for Cult Classic!  
  • Remuneration: We believe that actors should be able to perform AND get paid.  Help us support our performers with a donation to Loop Troupe!
  • Advertising:  This show isn't going to sell itself!  Part of your donation will go towards posters, newspaper ads, fliers, and more.

Cult Classic will be premiering whether we reach our goal or not.  Please help keep our ticket prices low and our production value high for YOU, the audience!

The Team

Here at Loop Troupe, we are committed to providing the public with entertaining, affordable theatre for the modern viewer.  After years of producing Shakespeare plays, short films, music performances, and more, we are finally ready to put up a full-length original play. 

Making the leap to the big apple is a huge challenge.  Luckily, we have our trusty team of Loopers to help out with the transition:

Producers: Chris Mackin, Tom Mackin, Bradley Michalakis

Writer: Tom Mackin

Director: Chris Mackin

Marketing: Taylor Weinberg

Social Media: Leanne Gallati 

Set Design: Nick Trimper

Technical Director: Harley Davidson

Costume Design: Sam Nugent

Sound Design: Taylor Weinberg

Composer: Danny Pravder

Featuring:  Tyler Downey, Anthony Gabriele, Tom Mackin, Brad Michalakis, Sam Nugent, and Eileen O'Connor 

Can't donate directly?

Don't panic! You can still help to make Cult Classic a success!

  • Take a trip to NYC and join us for the premier! 
  • Share this page to all your friends! If you hate us, share it with your enemies!
  • Like us at facebook.com/looptroupe
story_txt:
So What's This All About?
We are LOOP TROUPE, a group of NY based artists presenting our first full-length original comedy, Cult Classic!
Cult Classic follows yoga-guru turned cult-leader Marty, as he struggles to stop his followers from doing the unthinkable.  
Help us bring this timeless tale of hope, delusion, and yoga to Manhattan! 

Our Expenses
Help us reach our goal of $2,500!  It won't pay for everything, but it'll help!


Theater Space: Cult Classic will be premiering at the Royal Theatre at the Producers' Club, 358 West 44th Street.

Set: Help us turn this theater into "a tent in the middle of nowhere!"

Costumes: Hand made costumes from one of our Loop Troupe artists.

Props: What do a diamond ring, bolt cutters, and a functioning gong have in common? They're all props we need for Cult Classic!  

Remuneration: We believe that actors should be able to perform AND get paid.  Help us support our performers with a donation to Loop Troupe!

Advertising:  This show isn't going to sell itself!  Part of your donation will go towards posters, newspaper ads, fliers, and more.

Cult Classic will be premiering whether we reach our goal or not.  Please help keep our ticket prices low and our production value high for YOU, the audience!

The Team
Here at Loop Troupe, we are committed to providing the public with entertaining, affordable theatre for the modern viewer.  After years of producing Shakespeare plays, short films, music performances, and more, we are finally ready to put up a full-length original play. 

Making the leap to the big apple is a huge challenge.  Luckily, we have our trusty team of Loopers to help out with the transition:
Producers: Chris Mackin, Tom Mackin, Bradley Michalakis
Writer: Tom Mackin
Director: Chris Mackin
Marketing: Taylor Weinberg
Social Media: Leanne Gallati 
Set Design: Nick Trimper
Technical Director: Harley Davidson
Costume Design: Sam Nugent
Sound Design: Taylor Weinberg
Composer: Danny Pravder
Featuring:  Tyler Downey, Anthony Gabriele, Tom Mackin, Brad Michalakis, Sam Nugent, and Eileen O'Connor 

Can't donate directly?
Don't panic! You can still help to make Cult Classic a success!

Take a trip to NYC and join us for the premier! 
Share this page to all your friends! If you hate us, share it with your enemies!
Like us at facebook.com/looptroupe

story:
About the Creator of SPROUTED!

Nachi Lederer is an actor, singer, dancer, and playwright. He studies Theatre and Dance at Muhlenberg College in Allentown, PA. He has spent this past year working on various productions at the Black Box Performing Arts Center, where he performs and teaches, and has been teaching Drama at the Thomas Jefferson Middle School in Teaneck, NJ. 

During his studies and work in children’s theatre, Nachi realized the tremendous impact shows can have on kids. One of Nachi’s dreams is to create shows that the whole family can enjoy, while telling a meaningful story that teaches life lessons and espouses positive values. SPROUTED! is the first of Nachi's works to do just that.  

What's It About?

In the story of SPROUTED!, Jack is challenged to make the right decisions in complicated circumstances.  We learn, through Jack, that it's best to take a step back, analyze the situation, and then come up with a plan that would best benefit us and the people around us. But as events in life often do, things don't always turn out the way we plan.  It's important for children to learn how to make the best choice possible, when the line between right and wrong seems unclear. 

With lively songs and witty dialogue, SPROUTED! is a musical comedy that the whole family can enjoy. And with your generosity, SPROUTED! can bud and bloom miraculously! 

How Your Contribution Makes a Difference

We are having our first run of the show at the Black Box Performing Arts Center this summer, but we need your help. In order to cover the initial production expenses, including sets, costumes, props, lighting equipment, sound design, marketing, and additional personnel we are hoping to raise $4,500. We have wonderful perks to offer our generous donors; rewards include seasonal tickets, invitations to all SPROUTED! events, advertising space in our show programs, specially reserved seating to SPROUTED! performances, and more! The production will be truly magical if we meet our goal. However, if we are met with the unfortunate circumstance of not reaching our goal, we will put the funds we have acquired toward constructing the sets, creating the costumes and props, setting the lights, promoting the show, and forming the best cast, creative team, and 3-piece orchestra we can. SPROUTED! will soar through the sky!

BBPAC's last professional show for kids, Junie B. Jones The Musical, was a major success, with full houses at every performance. And this summer, SPROUTED! is sure to be a huge hit! Your advertisement in our show's program will be seen by everyone who comes to see SPROUTED! And if you advertise in our lobby, by becoming a "Bounteous Beanstalk Backer," everyone who sets foot into our theater will see your advertisement.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make a donation at this time, there are a number of ways you can assist in the process of getting this show up on its feet. You can share our campaign on social media platforms, reach out to anyone you think may be interested in supporting SPROUTED!, or reach out to Nachi via email (nachiled@gmail.com) to see what you can do to help!

story:
Video: Shakespeare Downtown's A Midsummer Night's Dream at Castle Clinton in 2018.  Directed by Geoffrey Horne. 

We hope you will be a part of the new Shakespeare theatre at Castle Clinton.

The mission of Shakespeare Downtown (SD) is to encourage an interest in classical theatre. By staging these free outdoor performances at Castle Clinton in The Battery, audience members experience the plays how they were originally done at Shakespeare's Globe Theatre 400 years ago: in the open-air, in the round, on the water. The actors wear Elizabethan costumes and perform inside the castle walls where we create a theatre complete with chairs, audio, and lights.

In 2016, we produced Romeo and Juliet, in 2017, Richard III, and in 2018, A Midsummer Night's Dream. In 2019, Shakespeare Downtown will produce Hamlet from June 13-23, (Thursdays through Sundays) from 6:30 pm to 9:00 pm. Performances are always free, and serve an audience of up to 250 each night, creating a truly accessible Shakespeare in the Park for Lower Manhattan.

Shakespeare Downtown evolved out of 10 years of successful productions. Geoffrey Horne, the director, is a founder of Shakespeare Downtown, and a long-time member of the Actors Studio. He has been an acting teacher at the Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute for over 35 years. He also worked as an actor in movies such as The Bridge on the River Kwai and Bonjour Tristesse, and in the theatre and television. Billie Andersson is the co-founder of Shakespeare Downtown, an actress, and producer of 14 plays. She is a graduate of Barnard, and studied acting at Strasberg, and with William Esper. Filmed excerpts of the plays can be seen at www.shakespearedowntown.org and at www.billieandersson.com.

We are working with the National Park Service, Downtown Alliance, Battery Park City Authority, the Battery Conservancy, and NYC & Company to spread the word about our free productions. In addition, New York Magazine, Time Out New York, The Observer, The Downtown Express, Tribeca Trib Online, and NY1 all promoted our past productions. Shakespeare Downtown was also featured on Fox 5's Good Day New York.

Well-known members of the acting community - Alec Baldwin, Terence McNally, Estelle Parsons, John Douglas Thompson, Anna Strasberg, and the late Mike Nichols have lent their names as supporters of Shakespeare Downtown. 

By supporting these free outdoor Shakespeare productions, you are helping to create the most accessible Shakespeare in the Park in New York City; and a new American Globe Theatre. Please join us in our endeavor! 

What we need:
$3,000 for the audio rental
$1,000 for the lights
$1,500 for 250 chairs
$1,500 for the insurance for the castle
$1,000 for the costumes
$500 for the programs and flyers
$8,500 total

Why we need your help:
Individual donations show community support and help us build our audience. Every single dollar helps us get closer to our goal.

Other ways you can help:
If you can't contribute, you can still help. Please share this campaign with your friends and family.

You can make a difference.
Thank you in advance for your generous support!

story:
Our Story

FUN HEAD meets You're Full of Air

Together, Sarah and Whitney conceived of this collaborative effort as an antidote to the culture of fear that dominates the current narrative.  The Sarah and Whitney Show examines and makes space for our collective need to seek pleasure, companionship, debauchery, and laughter.

 

http://sarahwebergallo-dance.com

https://www.jacobsdancecollective.org

Wait, wait! Don't go back to the internet yet!  

Our Needs​

Some of which have already been met: The Theatre!  Rehearsal Space!  and The Blow up Guys!

But we do need your financial support for ...

4 Designer Fees (Bring on the feathers!)

1 Gal/Guy in the Booth (a.k.a. Stage Manager)

8 Dancer Performance Fees

Publicity (Getting the butts in the seats in...August?!?)

That Dude Justin (a.k.a. Lighting Designer)

Muscle for Hire (Remember when you wished your internship was paid?)

Video (For the next episode of “Sorry I Missed Your Show”)

Choreographers - JUST KIDDING!!! 

TOTAL NEEDED - $5200

The Impact

Any contribution made will be greatly felt and greatly appreciated.  

Thank you so much for helping us bring our big visions to life!  

Please share! Thank you for spreading the word, and sharing our efforts on social media!

story:
About the Play

Upon first reading of this play, we were completely hooked. "Time Stands Still" focuses on Sarah and James, a photojournalist and a foreign correspondent trying to find happiness in a world that seems to have gone crazy. (Sound familiar? #MAGA) Theirs is a partnership based on telling the toughest stories, and together, making a difference. But when their own story takes a sudden turn while covering the Syrian conflict, the adventurous couple confronts the prospect of a more conventional life.

While exploring the place and importance of wartime journalism in the world, Sarah and James face a struggle that most everyone in present day America can relate to-- the balance between their responsibility to the cause, and their responsibility to each other and their life at home. By telling this story, we hope to ask these questions of our audience, and begin a larger dialogue about how we can achieve balance in our own lives, while still helping others.

Our Amazing Director 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Joel Zwick has had an extensive Film and Television career including “My Big Fat Greek Wedding”, “Full House”, “Bosom Buddies”, and “Laverne and Shirley”. His extensive Theater Career, started with LA MaMa Experimental Theatre Club in New York City. After leaving La MaMA, some of his highlights include directing the Tony Nominated musical “Dance With Me. And more recently, he directed the play “Gershwin Alone” on Broadway. He is excited to direct “Time Stands Still”, if for no other reason, so his son will stop bothering him to direct "Time Stands Still". 

 

Breakdown of Costs

It is our belief that theater has the power to engage and educate people on a local level, and initiate change from the ground up. By contributing to our campaign, you will be helping us mount a production that is not only extremely important to us, but also has the potential to create a much-needed discussion within our community.

Below is a breakdown of necessary costs to put on "Time Stands Still:"

Theatre rental:        $5,200 (for 12 performances)
Insurance:                $250 
Rehearsal Space:   $800 (for 3 weeks)
Rights to the Play: $1,200 
Set design:               $500
Set Construction:  $900
Lighting/Sound:    $750
Stage Manager:     $500
Publicist:                  $2,000
Costumes:               $200
Prosthetics:             $100
Props:                        $200
Programs:                $300
Advertising:             $500
Graphic Designer: $300

Total:                         $13,700

As you can see, putting on a production ain't cheap! But we know that with your generosity, we can make this thing happen! And as thanks for your donations to our project, we are offering a TON of awesome perks as detailed on the right hand column of this page!! :D

Our Charity Challenge

We also want you to know that in asking you to help us produce a play about wartime journalism, we're putting our money where our mouth is with an additional CHARITY CHALLENGE in this campaign. Once we hit certain funding goals along the way, we will donate a certain amount of our campaign donations Helping Hand for Relief and Development's Syrian Humanitarian Assistance Fund.

Here's how it works:

For every $2,000 we raise after we hit $8,000, we will donate $500 to Helping Hand, which means...

Once we hit $8,000, we will donate $500
Once we hit $10,000, we will donate an additional $500
Once we hit $12,000, we will donate an additional $500
And if we can hit our stretch goal of $14,000, we will donate an additional $500 for a
GRAND TOTAL of $2,000 to Helping Hand's Syrian Humanitarian Assistance Fund

For more information on Helping Hand, please visit http://hhrd.org/
For a detailed breakdown of Helping Hand's allocation of funds, please visit https://www.charitynavigator.org/index.cfm?bay=...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some of you simply can't contribute to our campaign, but you can still help us make this play a reality! If you would please SHARE the link to this Indiegogo campaign page with your friends and family on social media, WE WOULD BE SO GRATEFUL! The further we can spread the word, the better! Thank you so much!!

story:
MEET THE TEAM!

We are: Zeynep Gunaydin, Florrie McNish, Savithaa Markandu, Beth Fisher, Emily Morris and Amy Ann Kemp!​

Our core values as a team are:

  • Inclusion
  • Respect
  • Professionalism
  • Have Positive Expectations
  • Equality
  • Fun/Enjoyment
  • Creativity/Innovation
  • Positive Intent Research
  • Informed Practice Sustainable Experience

The Project and Our Practice

During our time in New York we will be working with a diverse range of Applied Theatre organisations and a youth-homeless shelter, devising projects in a range of settings that include youth, and adult community members, the New York Police department, rough sleepers, and hard to reach young people as well as some schools. As a group we are compelled by the crisis of rough sleepers and homeless youth in New York and feel very lucky to have this opportunity to work first hand with a group that are often overlooked and ignored by society. As a group we are excited to take on a new challenge we are really intrigued to work with the NYPD to see how a state-run organisation tackles this crisis and see how we can aid this initiative using our range of skills and experience through the medium of drama, performance, music and art. As a group, our most important manifesto point was to create sustainable experiences for participants by creating work that would keep on evolving and stay with them after the project has ended. We are aware that we are coming from a place of privilege, and so other parts of our manifesto draw attention to respect for the participants as creatives in their own right. We feel informed practice and equity are very important when working with this group. Participant led work will be at the core of our approach. We believe a combination of our strong group morals and passion for this social crisis equip us for this project.

We Need You!

We are lucky enough to have received some funding from the Leverhulme foundation, which covers flights and accommodation, but we still need your help. Money donated by you will be used for project costs, such as: additional travel costs in New York, visa costs, medical letter, travel insurance 

Most importantly the money you donate will go towards resources for our project workshops, to make sure our participants can have the most rewarding experience and explore a range of possibilities throughout the process. 

We would like to say thank you to anyone who wishes to donate to our project! We will be holding a raffle with some amazing prizes, and we will be announcing the winners in may. As well as this we also have some NYC/LDN Tote bags, Badges and Magnets up for grabs. When making your donation there will be an option to select these as part of your giving. 

Whilst we are out on project we will be sending updates to all those who have supported the project, documenting the process and our time working in NYC. 

Raffle Prizes Include: 

  • 2x full chicken platter vouchers for Nandos
  • 2x £10 vouchers from sushi and more
  • £50 Bills voucher for Bills restaurant 
  • 70cl small batch London dry gin
  • 35cl small batch craft gin
  • Legacy edition Jack Daniels
  • Fortnum and mason 25 earl grey tea bag set
  • NYC-LDN Badge and Magnet 

(All winners will be sent prizes before 15th May)

And many more! 

Thank you for reading our story, and please donate so our project can make a real difference!

- Scarlet Collective 

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/ScarletCollective19/

We believe a combination of our strong group morals and passion for this social crisis equip us for this project.We Need You!We are lucky enough to have received some funding from the Leverhulme foundation, which covers flights and accommodation, but we still need your help. Money donated by you will be used for project costs, such as: additional travel costs in New York, visa costs, medical letter, travel insurance Most importantly the money you donate will go towards resources for our project workshops, to make sure our participants can have the most rewarding experience and explore a range of possibilities throughout the process. We would like to say thank you to anyone who wishes to donate to our project! We will be holding a raffle with some amazing prizes, and we will be announcing the winners in may. As well as this we also have some NYC/LDN Tote bags, Badges and Magnets up for grabs. When making your donation there will be an option to select these as part of your giving. Whilst we are out on project we will be sending updates to all those who have supported the project, documenting the process and our time working in NYC. Raffle Prizes Include: 
2x full chicken platter vouchers for Nandos
2x £10 vouchers from sushi and more
£50 Bills voucher for Bills restaurant 
70cl small batch London dry gin
35cl small batch craft gin
Legacy edition Jack Daniels
Fortnum and mason 25 earl grey tea bag set
NYC-LDN Badge and Magnet 
(All winners will be sent prizes before 15th May)And many more! Thank you for reading our story, and please donate so our project can make a real difference!- Scarlet Collective FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/ScarletCollective19/

story:
Death Of A Shoe Salesman

A therapy group at the home of a vacuous neurotic, with a childlike nerd, and an angry cynic as her guests, turns deadly when a duplicitous Salesman arrives to hawk shoes!!!  Written in 1989 by Stephen Spurling for his Warren Central HS Theatre Department, this little play that won't die is about to have its SECOND showing in NYC!

  • Christopher Noffke is directing the second go around for this funny script at the NY Theatre Festival in NYC at the Hudson Guild Theatre and Neal Kowalsky is set to Stage Manage.
  • We are hoping to raise funds to pay for this production and make it the best it can be.
  • If you help us, we will be able to pay our actors for their time and talent, as well as the designers, props, rehearsal space, scripts, costumes, tech crew and more!
  • Current cast consists of Mel Gonzalez as the Salesman and PJ Johnnie as Roger the angry cynic.  Auditions are set for June 3rd and we hope to have a full cast announced soon!

CAST!!!!! 

 

HANNAH HOWZDY as Wanda (The Nymphomaniac)

PJ JOHNNIE as Roger (The Angry Cynic)

JACK FLATLEY as Charles (The childlike nerd)

SAVANNAH LLOYD as Dr. Blake (the legally blind one)

MEL GONZALES as The Salesman!!

MITCHELL TORRES as Cop 1 (The Brains)

 

DEAN SCOTTI as Cop 2 (The One with NO brains)

 

 

 

We hope to raise $3000

This is what your money will go towards:

  • Actors, Designers (Costume/Prop/Stage Management), props, rehearsal space, rehearsal scripts and materials, rehearsal props, audition space and advertising, publicity, marketing, and anything else that we might need.
  • Check out our perks to see what you can get for your small or BIG contribution.
  • If we do not reach our goal, all the money will continue to go into this fund for the show.  

THANK YOU

Every dollar you donate to "Death Of A Shoe Salesman" makes Stephen's play stay alive and continue to grow!!!

Challenges

In New York City, producing a new play is difficult.  It takes money and guts to follow your dreams,  The amount of money for each new piece of work and what it needs.  You are helping us follow our dreams.  Helping us overcome this challenge is not easy, we know, but we thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

You can share our fundraiser on social media, and with family and friends.  You never know who is ready to help keep Art alive and help us CREATE ART!  Thank you for anything you can do.

 

PURCHASE TICKETS NOW!!!!!!!

http://newyorktheaterfestival.com/death-of-a-sh...

story:
NEVER SWIM ALONE

Play Synopsis: Never Swim Alone is a swift, ferocious satire about two Alpha-Males and their ruthless competition to be crowned the winner. Frank and Bill, two men in dark suits and bad ties, square off in a thirteen-round battle royale of vicious insults and desperate one-upmanship in a bid to win the love of the Referee, a mysterious woman who controls the game and its competitors in a world where the only option is to be the first, and nothing is as it seems. Written by award-winning Canadian playwright Daniel MacIvor in 1991 and never performed professionally in the UK, Never Swim Alone experiments with form to present a haunting interrogation into perceptions of masculinity, egotism and how trauma shapes who we are.

WHO WE ARE

We are Forge Collective, a new theatre collective committed to staging new writing and reviving contemporary plays. We like finding hidden gems and bringing them to the fore, which is exactly what we want to achieve with our debut show – Never Swim Alone.

We performed Never Swim Alone back in October 2016 at the Caryl Churchill Theatre to a string of sold-out audiences. Now, we want to bring it back, making it better than ever – but we’re going to need your help. Creating a show can be an expensive venture and we need some help to cover a few essential costs. Any support you can give will play a vital role in ensuring we can realise the full potential of this show and, as a company, keep bringing you the hidden gems of theatre for a little while longer. 

MEET THE TEAM

AZAN AHMED - BILL

Azan is a London based actor. Having recently graduated from Royal Holloway University of London with a BA in English and Drama, he has performed in several plays, short films and some feature films. Azan is also a part of the Almeida Theatre's Young Company. He is grateful to Forge Collective for such a brilliant experience on this wonderful show.

TABATHA GREGG-ALLURED - REFEREE

Tabatha is currently in her third and final year studying English and Drama at Royal Holloway University of London. She has performed in many different productions whilst at the university and is also a performer for Wrong Shoe Theatre Company. She is excited to revive her performance as the Referee in Never Swim Alone.

JACK READ - FRANK

Jack is making his London theatre debut having performed in a number of shows throughout Surrey and Kent. This year he graduated with a BA in English and Drama from Royal Holloway University of London. He recently appeared in the sell-out run of Holy Sh*t with Brick Fox Theatre as Father Charlie Moss. And he is thrilled to be back working in such a complex and rich show with this wonderful company.

ALEXANDER HICK - ARTISTIC DIRECTOR 

Alexander Hick is a freelance theatre director. He is currently working as a Trainee Resident Director at the King's Head Theatre. His previous work includes the ★★★★★ An Abundance of Tims (Bread and Roses Theatre, Tristan Bates Theatre, King's Head Theatre, Edinburgh Fringe).

BLUEY LITTLE - MARKETING MANAGER

Bluey Little is a recent Drama and Theatre Studies graduate from Royal Holloway. She has produced and marketed numerous student productions and recently assisted with the publicity for Shepard Tone’s An Abundance of Tims. She is ecstatic to be involved with Forge Collective and this incredible production.

SAXON ROSE MUDGE - PRODUCER

Saxon is a freelance Producer based in London. Having recently graduated from Royal Holloway University with a BA in English and Drama, she has produced a number of shows and recently completed a producing residency with The Wardrobe Ensemble in collaboration with The North Wall Arts Centre. She is thrilled to be working with Forge Collective on such a fantastic show.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHERE THE MONEY WILL GO 

Putting on a show in London comes with some costs. While we are seeking funding from various sources, we still need some help! The £1000 we hope to raise through this campaign will play an invaluable role in the completion of Never Swim Alone. 

Here is a breakdown of where the money will go:

PAYING OUR ARTISTS
Alongside our fantastic cast and crew, we have hired some Photographers and a Sound Designer to help bring Never Swim Alone to life. £330 of the money raised will go towards making sure we can pay these artists the fee they deserve. After all, the show wouldn't be the same without their amazing work!

MARKETING
With London being the UK's largest hub for theatre, we have a lot of competition and as an emerging company, it's important to stand out and get people interested in the show! Our marketing includes getting flyers and posters designed and printed, as well as enough programmes to cover our 6-night run. We also need to create online promotional content. This includes Facebook Ads, Instagram Ads, email communications and website fees. £290 of the money raised will go towards our marketing costs, ensuring people know who we are and what we're creating.

SET DESIGN
Our set is extremely minimal. However, our vision includes special flooring which will take our design to the next level. £100 of the money raised will go towards buying enough flooring to cover our stage space.

COSTUMES
Frank and Bill are men that look good and dress well. Or at least they think they do. Although their ties are bad and their suits bright, dressing our characters is no easy venture. £180 of the money raised will go towards making sure Frank, Bill and the Referee are fully dressed and looking as suave as can be.

PROPS
This technical production requires a list of very specific props, many of which require making from scratch. £100 of the money raised will go towards buying the props and materials we need to bring the show to life. 

This money is only the beginning, so anything more will go back into the project to help cover the many other costs that come with bringing Never Swim Alone to London. 

WANT TO SUPPORT US?

If you love the sound of what we do and want to help, check out our fun perks you can receive if you donate!

- Forge Collective will follow you on Twitter.

- A shout out on social media.

- Your name featured on our website and programme.

- A personalised postcard written and sent to you from the cast and crew.

- A disposable camera full of rehearsal photos that are unique to you!

- Get a Spotify playlist full of summer songs designed especially for you.

- Or if that's not enough, get a digital copy of 'The Referee's Rule Book' - a book full of photos and insights into our process, including a list of the rules behind the game that nobody else gets to see!

- Two front row tickets to Never Swim Alone!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Every share/follow is helpful! Please share this campaign as far and wide as you can. Think Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Emails, word of mouth - the more sharing the better!

Additionally, feel free to follow our Twitter/Facebook pages!

 Twitter: @CollectiveForge

 Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ForgeCollective/

We also welcome you to attend our show! Details below:

Tickets: https://www.ticketea.co.uk/tickets-theatre-neve...

"Never Swim Alone"

November 27th - December 1st 2018 - 7pm
December 2nd 2018 - 6.30pm

The Etcetera Theatre

ADDRESS: 265 Camden High Street
(above the Oxford Arms)
Camden, London NW1 7BU

TUBE: Camden Town (Northern Line)
BUS: 24, 27, 29, 31, 88, 134, 168, 214, 253, 274, and C2
OVERGROUND: Camden Road

THANK YOU

Thank you so much for supporting Never Swim Alone! With your help, Forge Collective can continue to do what we love and keep bringing you brilliant new work.

 

Forge Collective

Azan Ahmed
Tabatha Gregg-Allured
Alexander Hick
Bluey Little
Saxon Mudge
Jack Read

story:
Who We Are

Blank was founded by 4 friends from different theatrical & educational backgrounds who all believe in the importance of sharing art with the world.

Our Mission & Core Values

Blank Theatre Company aims to present our audiences with work that is both timely & timeless. Through thematically accessible plays & musicals, we hope to stimulate powerful thought and emotion by carrying on the rich tradition of artistic empowerment and camaraderie in the Chicago theatre community.

NEXT GENERATION - Taking Established works into it.

ALIGNMENT - Restructuing a collaborative artistic connection between ourselves, other theatres and the community. 

COMPETENCY - Respect for artists and professionalism

DEDICATION - Full commitment to each individual project. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $5000 (one third of our projected budget) to help us begin planning for the 2018-2019 season.
  • All funds will be going towards production rights, rehearsal & performance space, hiring designers & actors, props, costumes etc.
  • If you donate, your generosity will be publicized by us on various platforms and there are tickets to be had to our cabaret fundraiser in September!   

The Impact

Starting a theatre company with no startup funding is a daunting task. With your help, Blank Theatre Company will be able to bring quality musicals and plays to the north side of Chicago.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help please share our campaign with your family and friends. Post about us on all your social media platforms! Any help you can bring to our theatrical future is appreciated beyond words.
