story:
APPETIZERS:

We are the creators of last year's FringeNYC show PARKER & DIZZY'S FABULOUS JOURNEY TO THE END OF THE RAINBOW. Michael Giltz of the Huffington Post highlighted Parker & Dizzy as one of the "Best Shows of 2011," citing it as the "most promising musical at FringeFest." Now writers Peter Zachari and Damon Maida have reteamed with musical director Douglas Maxwell and choreographer Joey Mirabile to begin production on their latest new musical FAT ASSES. 

We had an amazing run during the FringeNYC last year and it was because of YOU, our friends and contributors. Because of your donations, you helped make our dreams come true. We are now asking once again for your help to allow us to introduce our new musicals to the New York City audiences!

ENTREES:

We sucessfully raised a little over $5000 for our first campaign which helped with some production cists, but we still an additional $2000 to meet our goal! Producing theater in New York City is quite costly, and your donations will go to every aspect of the production. Rental space, sets, lights, costume, sound, makeup, staff, etc. By contributing money to this project, you are helping the artists associated with this project to see an original production come to fruition. 

SPECIALS:

This show is a special one for many people. In the play, MARGAUX, CANDY and LACEY are fed up with being outcasts in society. They are even kicked out of their weight loss program, Baggage Battlers. Uniting with an ex-militant singer, the quartet set out to overthrow the popular fashion magazine, GAUNT. The ladies are instantly thrust into the spotlight and find themselves basking in the glow of popular success. But as the women soon discover, success has a high price, forcing them to face their demons head on and reveal secrets no one knew they had...

Filled with fantastically fun songs including, "FED UP!," "SHOWSTOPPER," "A TASTE OF FASHION," "TRENDING," "CHECK HERE," and "RECIPE FOR LOVE." Last year we had considerable success at the NY International Fringe Festival with Parker & Dizzy. In fact, our first show was extended to an off-Broadway theatre for the Encores series. 

DESSERTS:

The success of this campaign depends on you! Help us spread the word by posting this campaign on your Facebook page. Tweet it out to your friends. Email it to people who might be interested in helping out a bunch of people trying to bring new art into the world. 

THANK YOU SO MUCH for your help. Without you, none of this would be possible.

YOUR SERVERS:

Heather Anderson (Candy) is thrilled to be a part of the Fat Asses Cast. Last seen in The Secret Theatre’s The Wild Party (Mae); Past credits include Hold, Please (Strawberry One Act Festival Best Actress Nominee); I Love You, You’re Perfect, Now Change, Beehive, The Vagina Monologues, The Sound of Music (Roxy Regional Theater); RENT (Boiler Room Theater); The Wedding Singer (Circle Players Best Supporting Actress Winner). Love and so much gratitude to K, C, and her incredible parents. www.heatherandersononline.com

Jane Aquilina (Dustine) Songbird, Scribe and Funnylady, Jane Aquilina, (affectionately known as “Miss Jane”), a native San Franciscan, transplanted herself to the city that never sleeps to shake it up on the East Coast. She self-produced and wrote a one-woman semi-autobiographical, demi-tassed cabaret entitled “Bawdy n’ Soul” that was performed at The Metropolitan Room and has been been gracing the New York stages for the last decade performing and producing stand-up shows at Laugh Lounge, Caroline’s, Gotham and The Duplex.  Also, with a handful of cabaret performances under her belt as an honorary member of HonKbarK Theatre Company as well as a new member of Bizarre Noir Theatre Company, she enjoys taking current and old standards and adding a blues, funk or Brechtian twist.  She’s shared the stage with such musical luminaries as Myron Dove (Santana), Benny Rietveld (Miles Davis, Santana), Rubens de la Cortes (Angelique Kidjo, Eriana Erias), Nanny Assis, Mike Zilber and Manu Koch. Back home, she was a founding member of SketchMarks, an all-girl gender-bending sketch troupe and played an array of characters from Andy Warhol to Santa Claus.  One original character, Carmelita Alameda de las Pulgas, was inspiration for a two-woman show, “The C n’ C Cuban Factory:  We’re Here, We’re Cuban, Get Used to It” – it sold out some houses, busted some guts and made a few bucks. Jane will be playing Louella Parsons in Bizarre Noir Theatre Company's version of "Cat's Meow" in April!
 
Elise Castle (Joanne, etc.) is THRILLED to be working with this fabulous team once more, after appearing in Parker and Dizzy's Fabulous Journey to the End of the Rainbow in the NYC Fringe Festival. Elise is an actor, writer, and self proclaimed "Old School Showgirl". Most recently Elise appeared as Margaret in 9 to 5 : The Musical at Theatre By The Sea. As a writer Elise maintains a weekly blog combining a little sarcasm, a little spirituality, and a little Les Mis. As a showgirl, Elise is a founding member of the comedy group "Nancy". Thanks to Peter, Joey, ice cream, and control top panty hose. 
Kelly Teal Goyette (Margaux) This VT native is incredibly honored to be a part of FAT ASSES: THE MUSICAL. Now residing in Astoria, Queens, Kelly is an actor/singer/karaoke queen who most recently appeared as The Dragon/Mama Bear in the national tour of SHREK the Musical. Other credits include, Tour: GREASE (Miss Lynch), ANNIE (Mrs. Pugh/Hannigan u/s)  Regional: RENT (Joanne), The Pajama Game (Mable), The Full Monty (Vicki Nichols). Special thanks to my family, friends, Peter and Joey, Nathaniel and of course Mom. 
 
Joey Mirabile (Foster; Choreographer) has choreographed Parker and Dizzy's Fabulous Journey to the End of the Rainbow for the FringeNYC, Footloose, Grease and Into the Woods for Summer Theatre at Salem as well as Godspell, Cinderella, Holly Jolly Follies and Broadway Our Way. Acting credits include Parker and Dizzy's Fabulous Journey to the End of the Rainbow (Dizzy), Company (Bobby), Grease (Danny),Theyre Playing Our Song (Vernon), Footloose (Garvin), Antigone (Sentry), The Snow Queen (Jack Frost), Six Degrees of Separation (Rick), 42nd Street (Billy Lawlor). He could be seen as Nathaniel Hawthorne in Spirits of the Gables at the House of Seven Gables every Halloween in Salem. Joey is also known as Coco of Times Square.

Caitlin McGinty (Meredith) is thrilled to be a part of the Fat Asses family!! She most recently had the privilege of playing Maria in Sound of Music. Caitlin has also performed in shows such as Spelling Bee (Rona), Kiss Me Kate (Katharine), A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum, Hair, and Nine. Prior to moving to New York last year, she lived in San Francisco, where she appeared in Beach Blanket Babylon, the world’s longest running musical revue. There, she played everyone from Hilary Clinton to Barbra Streisand.Caitlin received a B.F.A. in Drama from the University of CA, Irvine. Thank you to her parents and to Richie for all of their love and support! 

Itanza Wooden (Lacey) a native Floridian, relocated to NYC thirteen years ago to pursue her dream of performing on Broadway. Before moving to NYC, Itanza throughout the East Coast and Midwest doing regional theater, performing in over thirty shows in Indiana, Illinois, Connecticut, New York and throughout Florida. At the University of Florida she appeared in Baby, Company, Godspell, Much Ado About Nothing and Cabaret. Regional credits include To Kill a Mockingbird (Calpurnia), As You Like it (Amiens), Little Shop of Horrors (Cristal), Ain't Misbehavin' (Nell Carter), Big River (Alice), South Pacific (Bloody Mary), Best Little Whorehouse in Texas (Jewel). Itanza is very proud of the two years spent at the Walt Disney Resort in Orlando, Florida where she created the role of Zawadi in the Festival of the Lion King at Disney's Animal Kingdon. In 2002, Itanza starred in her first NYC cabaret show at the Duplex Cabaret Theater entitled Men Are Pigs, But I Like Pork. She holds a Bachelor fo Fine Arts in Musical Theatre Performance from the University of Florida. Itanza would like to thank Peter for this opportunity to work together again. 

Peter Zachari (Playwright/Lyrics) has written Lighten Up!, which was produced off-off-Broadway, as well as Loosen Up!, Shake It Up!, Live It Up!, One Love and his newest play Parker and Dizzys Fabulous Journey to the End of the Rainbow. Mr. Zacharis directing credits include Into the Woods, Footloose, Rumors, Grease, West Side Story, Theyre Playing Our Song, Return to the Forbidden Planet and Moon Over Buffalo .  As an actor, his New York credits include Street Scene (The York Theatre Company), Connections (Actors Theatre of America), 1940s Radio Hour (The Emelin Theatre), The All-Male Importance of Being Earnest (New York International Fringe Festival), and Happy Hour (The Producers Club).  Regional credits include Loves Labours Lost (Huntington), The Illusion, All in the Timing, Laughter on the 23rd Floor, A Christmas Carol and 4R Planet (Hippodrome State Theatre); Big River and Young Abe Lincoln (Lincoln Amphitheatre); A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum, Last of the Red Hot Lovers, Mary, Mary (Summer Theatre at Salem); The Flatlanders (Dollywood) and Fiddler on the Roof and Cabaret(Center for the Performing Arts, Gainesville).  His television credits include White Collar, As the World Turns, The Life of Lizzie Borden, and Half Empty.  He received his M.F.A. from the University of Florida and his B.F.A. from Salem State College. 

Damon Maida (Music/Lyrics) is a singer and songwriter based in New York City. As a performer, he has appeared at some of New York's premiere listening rooms (The Bitter End, Symphony Space, Piano's,Triad) . Damon is a frequent co-writer and is excited to be working with Peter Zachari, composing music for "Parker & Dizzy..." When not writing songs with Peter, Damon can be seen singing with his vocal band The Perspective (www.theperspectiveband.com). Also an actor and voice-over artist, Damon's voice can be heard on a number of children's video games, commercials, and the newest "World of Warcraft: Cataclysm" video game. Damon is currently writing music for the follow-up to his debut album, "Only Child," available through CD Baby (http://cdbaby.com/cd/maida) and Apple ITunes.

Douglas Maxwell (Musical Director / Arranger) has been lucky to work with incredibly talented singers and songwriters around the various theatre scenes in NYC for the past ten years.  You probably haven’t seen him before unless you frequent the 1 train to the Upper Upper West Side on a regular basis.  Critics have hailed this 13-year old bouzouki player as the harbinger of a new class of musicians who "phone it in.”  TheNew York Post declared, "Magical, spell-binding, and ethereal" (as words that basically mean the same thing) and Roger Ebert gave two enthusiastic thumbs up (to the final Harry Potter movie).
story_txt:
APPETIZERS:
We are the creators of last year's FringeNYC show PARKER & DIZZY'S FABULOUS JOURNEY TO THE END OF THE RAINBOW. Michael Giltz of the Huffington Post highlighted Parker & Dizzy as one of the "Best Shows of 2011," citing it as the "most promising musical at FringeFest." Now writers Peter Zachari and Damon Maida have reteamed with musical director Douglas Maxwell and choreographer Joey Mirabile to begin production on their latest new musical FAT ASSES. 
We had an amazing run during the FringeNYC last year and it was because of YOU, our friends and contributors. Because of your donations, you helped make our dreams come true. We are now asking once again for your help to allow us to introduce our new musicals to the New York City audiences!


ENTREES:
We sucessfully raised a little over $5000 for our first campaign which helped with some production cists, but we still an additional $2000 to meet our goal! Producing theater in New York City is quite costly, and your donations will go to every aspect of the production. Rental space, sets, lights, costume, sound, makeup, staff, etc. By contributing money to this project, you are helping the artists associated with this project to see an original production come to fruition. 


SPECIALS:
This show is a special one for many people. In the play, MARGAUX, CANDY and LACEY are fed up with being outcasts in society. They are even kicked out of their weight loss program, Baggage Battlers. Uniting with an ex-militant singer, the quartet set out to overthrow the popular fashion magazine, GAUNT. The ladies are instantly thrust into the spotlight and find themselves basking in the glow of popular success. But as the women soon discover, success has a high price, forcing them to face their demons head on and reveal secrets no one knew they had...
Filled with fantastically fun songs including, "FED UP!," "SHOWSTOPPER," "A TASTE OF FASHION," "TRENDING," "CHECK HERE," and "RECIPE FOR LOVE." Last year we had considerable success at the NY International Fringe Festival with Parker & Dizzy. In fact, our first show was extended to an off-Broadway theatre for the Encores series. 
DESSERTS:


The success of this campaign depends on you! Help us spread the word by posting this campaign on your Facebook page. Tweet it out to your friends. Email it to people who might be interested in helping out a bunch of people trying to bring new art into the world. 
THANK YOU SO MUCH for your help. Without you, none of this would be possible.
YOUR SERVERS:










Heather Anderson (Candy) is thrilled to be a part of the Fat Asses Cast. Last seen in The Secret Theatre’s The Wild Party (Mae); Past credits include Hold, Please (Strawberry One Act Festival Best Actress Nominee); I Love You, You’re Perfect, Now Change, Beehive, The Vagina Monologues, The Sound of Music (Roxy Regional Theater); RENT (Boiler Room Theater); The Wedding Singer (Circle Players Best Supporting Actress Winner). Love and so much gratitude to K, C, and her incredible parents. www.heatherandersononline.com
















Jane Aquilina (Dustine) Songbird, Scribe and Funnylady, Jane Aquilina, (affectionately known as “Miss Jane”), a native San Franciscan, transplanted herself to the city that never sleeps to shake it up on the East Coast. She self-produced and wrote a one-woman semi-autobiographical, demi-tassed cabaret entitled “Bawdy n’ Soul” that was performed at The Metropolitan Room and has been been gracing the New York stages for the last decade performing and producing stand-up shows at Laugh Lounge, Caroline’s, Gotham and The Duplex.  Also, with a handful of cabaret performances under her belt as an honorary member of HonKbarK Theatre Company as well as a new member of Bizarre Noir Theatre Company, she enjoys taking current and old standards and adding a blues, funk or Brechtian twist.  She’s shared the stage with such musical luminaries as Myron Dove (Santana), Benny Rietveld (Miles Davis, Santana), Rubens de la Cortes (Angelique Kidjo, Eriana Erias), Nanny Assis, Mike Zilber and Manu Koch. Back home, she was a founding member of SketchMarks, an all-girl gender-bending sketch troupe and played an array of characters from Andy Warhol to Santa Claus.  One original character, Carmelita Alameda de las Pulgas, was inspiration for a two-woman show, “The C n’ C Cuban Factory:  We’re Here, We’re Cuban, Get Used to It” – it sold out some houses, busted some guts and made a few bucks. Jane will be playing Louella Parsons in Bizarre Noir Theatre Company's version of "Cat's Meow" in April!
 

Elise Castle (Joanne, etc.) is THRILLED to be working with this fabulous team once more, after appearing in Parker and Dizzy's Fabulous Journey to the End of the Rainbow in the NYC Fringe Festival. Elise is an actor, writer, and self proclaimed "Old School Showgirl". Most recently Elise appeared as Margaret in 9 to 5 : The Musical at Theatre By The Sea. As a writer Elise maintains a weekly blog combining a little sarcasm, a little spirituality, and a little Les Mis. As a showgirl, Elise is a founding member of the comedy group "Nancy". Thanks to Peter, Joey, ice cream, and control top panty hose. 















Kelly Teal Goyette (Margaux) This VT native is incredibly honored to be a part of FAT ASSES: THE MUSICAL. Now residing in Astoria, Queens, Kelly is an actor/singer/karaoke queen who most recently appeared as The Dragon/Mama Bear in the national tour of SHREK the Musical. Other credits include, Tour: GREASE (Miss Lynch), ANNIE (Mrs. Pugh/Hannigan u/s)  Regional: RENT (Joanne), The Pajama Game (Mable), The Full Monty (Vicki Nichols). Special thanks to my family, friends, Peter and Joey, Nathaniel and of course Mom.

Prior to moving to New York last year, she lived in San Francisco, where she appeared in Beach Blanket Babylon, the world’s longest running musical revue. There, she played everyone from Hilary Clinton to Barbra Streisand.Caitlin received a B.F.A. in Drama from the University of CA, Irvine. Thank you to her parents and to Richie for all of their love and support!

story:
Please visit www.indiegogo.com/icaligulamusicalphase2 to help us continue to raise production funds for our original  theatre work, "I, Caligula, An Insanity Musical", for the World Premiere in Los Angeles, CA in August 2012! Thank you all for your support and generosity!

 

Here is a short synopsis of the stage musical for which we are asking your support:

“When the lines blur - who is to blame? Confined to an asylum, a group of mentally ill patients attempt to demonstrate their rehabilitation by mounting an original musical production about Caligula, the insane first century Roman Emperor. Mayhem ensues in the form of a tragic comedy that parodies fascist dictators (even those of the 21st century), as the inmates’ "real" lives parallel, intermingle and unravel in unexpected ways with the lives of the characters they are portraying. The inmates question fantasy vs. reality, asking "who really creates a dictator -- the figurehead or the people who follow orders?" -- finally staging a rebellion with real life consequences. All of these elements are delivered with humor, romance, and irony -- bold and risqué, great music, full of showmanship, singing, dancing, and dialogue - theatre at its best - entertaining, intriguing and thought provoking, all in one!"

www.icaligulathemusical.com

I am a composer and pianist passionate about the theatre, who loves to create new works that bring thoughtful entertainment, enlightenment, illusion and soul-searching moments  to the stage with my music. Together with my script and lyric writing colleague Kai Cofer, we have a sum of over 70 years in the professional theatre world, having shared our artistry with audiences from New York to Maui, from Seattle to Los Angeles, as well as Europe. We have ceaselessly given from our hearts and minds and the depths of souls to the community, despite the most challenging circumstances at times -- and we are now humbly asking that the community give back by helping us produce our latest work, "I, Caligula, An Insanity Musical", a contemporary yet timeless musical that parodies dictatorship. We believe that you will find our work humorous, profound, lyrical, delightful, thought-provoking, as apropos of the events of today as much as of two thousand years ago! By making a contribution at whatever level you feel moved to share, you are supporting writers, actors and fellow philanthropists by keeping stage alive - an art form that has always reflected humanity at its best and its worst, even in hard economic times.

We have been investing every last dime of our own personal funds to mount this production, and we need your help. Our small production company is blessed with the amazing talent, devotion and experience of a "dream" cast and creative team -- we have all the elements for this show to be a huge success, and move on to larger venues in the future. Our choreographer and actors have created and played on major stages around the globe and here in Los Angeles area. Playing in a small theatre has both advantages and disadvantages - ticket sales will certainly help, but it must also be a labor of love for the common good. We are asking for $5,000 to help ensure that all our obligations to the cast, crew and theatre are met, and that our investors (at 0% interest rate, thank you!) are reimbursed. We have made plans to professionally video-tape and photograph the show and produce a DVD that can be sold, additionally benefitting the cast, stipends as well as any remaining expenses still owed. The "perks" listing is still in the early stage -- plans are in place, for example to provide custom pieces of art, sculpture and paintings that will be shown in the lobby -- but the most important reward for you is that of supporting live theatre and original works! Please visit our website: www.icaligulathemusical.com, to see more about the show and hear audio excerpts from the fully orchestrated demo featuring our splendid cast! To learn more about the writer, Kai Cofer, and composer, Cody Gillette, you can also visit their website for their opera/musical based on the work of Alexandre Dumas, "The Count of Monte Cristo" at www.montecristotheopera.com Thank you in advance for your generous support of the arts!

story:
An American story that is not in history books.The Tuskegee Airmen were dedicated, determined young men who enlisted to become America's first black military airmen, at a time when there were many people who thought that black men lacked intelligence, skill, courage and patriotism. Each one possessed a strong personal desire to serve the United States of America at the best of his ability. Black Angels Over Tuskegee is a play that elevates the human condition on and off the battlefield. 

 

Black Angels Over Tuskegee is enchanting audiences and critics with each and every performance.          

“Some plays teach, others celebrate, and a few simply entertain. "Black Angels Over Tuskegee" manages to do all three and one thing more: It inspires. “ – Backstage

 “My grandfather is a Tuskegee Airman, and said this play was dead on. I cried, he cried, the whole audience cried.” – Timeout.com 

“A deeply wonderful production that takes an important historical event, presents it in a very intimate manner, and demands a personal response to its characters.” – NYTheatre.com

“At its best, "Black Angels Over Tuskegee"...grooves like a tight jazz band, with snappy riffs of dialogue, bluesy monologues, and a couple of spontaneous song-and-dance routines.” – Backstage

 “Powerful...well-staged and the characters so realistic that the audience can't help but be thoroughly moved by the time the narrator reaches the end of the journal.” – Associated Press

“ This show is tough to resist.” – The New York Times

“By passing the usual research methods (books and archival documents), he [Gray – writer, director] went to the most authentic source: the Tuskegee Airmen themselves. It is thus their words that imbue this moving story with its authenticity.” – CurtainUp Review

“Black Angels is a consequential story, told through a captivating narrative and painted with a respectful brush. The writing is both astute and playful, making for exceptional characterization. “ – Theasy.com

“Black Angels Over Tuskegee is a deeply wonderful production that takes an important historical event, presents it in a very intimate manner, and demands a personal response to its characters.” – NYTheatre.com

 “Gray keeps the action flowing, and his air battles are both poetic and exciting.” – Back Stage

 “Doing triple duty as a playwright, director, and actor, Layon Gray presents a compelling and heartfelt look at an all too often overlooked aspect of black, military, and American history with his absolutely brilliant drama Black Angels Over Tuskegee.” – The Epoch Times

 “The author has a natural feel for dialogue and has created seven distinct, believable young men.  Characters so realistic that the audience can’t help but be thoroughly moved.” – CBS News

 “Gray has taken the time to set up these characters and they are all so incredibly well acted, there is an audience craving to know what happens to each of them.  The commanding ensemble embody how deeply-felt, specific acting can be.” – NY Theatre.com

story:
What We're Doing

Disco Pigs by Enda Walsh
Disco Pigs follows Pig and Runt, best friends living in Cork, Ireland, as they navigate their coming of age. Inseparable since birth, they have always faced the world together, but as their 17th birthday celebration goes on, their friendship will be put to the test. Will Pig and Runt be able to hold on to their kingdom of Pork City, or will the booze, lust, and violence break their extraordinary bond?

The Oberon's nightclub atmosphere is the perfect stage for this immersive and electrifying theatrical event. Disco Pigs explores not only the seemingly unbreakable relationship of the characters, but also the interwoven relationship between the audience and the performers. Theatergoers will be invited into the world of Pork City while the play unfolds around them. Joining Pig and Runt on their adventure around Cork, the audience will be an integral part of an unique and innovative theatrical experience.

June 19, 2014 at 8pm
Club Oberon, Cambridge, MA
CLICK HERE FOR EVENT AND TICKET INFORMATION

Why You Should Support Us

From rehearsal space, to rights, to props, to artist fees, to marketing materials, and microphones, we need your help! Our goal of $1600 would make Disco Pigs possible; we also believe in paying our cast and creative team for all of their hard work, and we need your support to make this show a success! Help support the next generation of theatermakers flourish in bringing this unique theatrical event to Boston!

  • The rights to produce Disco Pigs cost $120
  • Rehearsal space will cost roughly $400
  • Marketing materials will cost roughly $200
  • Props will cost roughly $100
  • Microphone rentals will cost $100
  • Artist fees will be roughly $580

Who We Are

Creative Team:
Playwright: Enda Walsh
Director: Colleen Hughes
Sound Designer: Sean Patterson
Vocal Coach: Thomas Rene

Cast:
Runt: Sarah Elizabeth Mitchell
Pig: Ernest-Leon Paulin 

Colleen first heard about Enda Walsh's Disco Pigs while studying abroad in Belfast, Ireland. Ever since then she had a dream to work on this singular piece of theater. After moving back to Boston this year, Colleen decided the time and place were right to bring Pork City across the Atlantic. After meeting and sharing the script with Sarah, Ernest, Sean and Thomas, Colleen and her team were convinced that Pig and Runt's story was ready to be told to a Boston audience. 

How Will Your Support Impact Disco Pigs?

Help us produce this unconventional piece of not-often produced theater, by one of Ireland's greatest living playwrights! You will be supporting young and emerging artists, and ensuring that we can create without worry, to produce an exciting, immersive and innovative production. Please donate and purchase a ticket to join us for an evening of theater you won't forget.

Other Ways Can You Support Disco Pigs

  • Help us get the word out!
  • Share our campaign on Facebook or Twitter!
  • Tell your friends about Disco Pigs!
  • COME SEE THE SHOW!
story_txt:
What We're Doing
Disco Pigs by Enda WalshDisco
Pigs follows Pig and
Runt, best friends living in Cork, Ireland, as they navigate their coming
of age. Inseparable since birth, they have always faced the world together, but
as their 17th birthday celebration goes on, their friendship will be put to the
test. Will Pig and Runt be able to hold on to their kingdom of Pork City, or
will the booze, lust, and violence break their extraordinary bond?The 
Oberon's nightclub atmosphere is the perfect stage for
this immersive and electrifying theatrical event. Disco Pigs explores
not only the seemingly unbreakable relationship of the characters, but also the
interwoven relationship between the audience and the performers.
Theatergoers will be invited into the world of Pork City while the play
unfolds around them. Joining Pig and Runt on their adventure around Cork, the
audience will be an integral part of an unique and innovative theatrical
experience.June 19, 2014 at 8pmClub Oberon, Cambridge, MACLICK HERE FOR EVENT AND TICKET INFORMATIONWhy You Should Support UsFrom rehearsal space, to rights, to props, to artist fees, to marketing materials, and microphones, we need your help! Our goal of $1600 would make Disco Pigs possible; we also believe in paying our cast and creative team for all of their hard work, and we need your support to make this show a success! story:
The Show

(bracket) Theatre is thrilled to announce the world premiere of Frances and Marybeth.


Frances and Marybeth

by Neale Kimmel

Directed by Heather Keith


Two sisters. Three men. Fourteen litres of milk. One ultimate date night.

A modern dilemma. A classic comedy of errors.


Frances has just had a life moment. What's a life moment? She's not entirely sure, but she is determined to drag herself off the couch, forget about her cheating ex-fiance and throw the ultimate date night. And, she's dragging her younger sister Marybeth, an artist who sells her paint by numbers on Craigslist, along for the ride. With the handsome Spanish man Frances picks up at the grocery store, and Marybeth's Craigslist boyfriend due to arrive any minute, an unexpected party crasher makes the evening a little more colourful than they had expected.


An outrageous comedy about love, moustaches and picking up the pieces, Frances and Marybeth are two sisters learning that sometimes to get it right, you have to paint outside the lines.


The show will run from March 8th to the 18th, 2012 in Factory Theatre's Studio Space in Toronto.


Featuring; Jesse Bond*, Carolyn Hall, Meaghen Quinn, David Ross* and Matt Wells.

(*appearing with permission of Equity)


Production History


(bracket) Theatre is an independent theatre company founded by Heather Keith and Neale Kimmel, two ladies with the goal of producing female driven stories that bring exciting new voices and faces to Toronto audiences. The dedicated team working on this production are highly experienced theatre artists, who passionately beleive in the originality and knee-slapping humour of this piece.

Frances and Marybeth (act 1) was selected by a blind jury to be produced at Alumnae Theatre's New Ideas Festival in March 2011. Act 1 was workshopped for two months before playing to sold out audiences over a five show run. The festival experience proved to be quite fortuitous, as it sparked the creative collaboration of director Heather Keith, playwright Neale Kimmel and lead actresses Carolyn Hall and Meaghen Quinn. After quickly becoming an audience favourite, Frances and Marybeth has since been developed into a full length comedy of errors. Now, with the key creative team reuniting and the addition of some exciting new talent, Frances and Marybeth is ready to make the transition from festival darling to mainstage gem.


What we need & what you get

Every penny raised through our fundraising efforts will go directly towards our production costs. These costs include paying for rehearsal space, venue rental, building sets, publicity for the show and costumes. To make this production possible, we need to raise $5,000.

This production of Frances and Marybeth will be made possible through means of fundraising and donations. We are encouraging our audience to be involved in our journey to the stage! We want you to become a part of production experience by getting the inside scoop of the play by play on Twitter (follow @Neale Kimmel), reading the playwright's daily production blog www.francesandmarybeth.com, and helping us make production decisions through conversations on facebook.


Other ways you can help

Most importantly, believe in us, believe in the project. The Frances and Marybeth team is a group of artists who believe that great things can come from small places. We believe in this show. We're living the dream and we want you to come along for the ride.

Help us spread the word! Share our story and this campaign with others and help us let people know about this exciting show and our adventure to the Factory Theatre. Every donation helps us create the best show we possibly can for our audience. 

Come and see the show! Can't wait to see you there.


For more information about this production and everyone involved please visit our website www.francesandmarybeth.com


Factory Theatre

125 Bathurst Street,

Toronto, ON

M5V 2R2

www.factorytheatre.ca

story:
DRVN

DRVN is a portable drive-in movie theater available in upstate South Carolina. As a lifelong fan of movies, it's been a dream to offer the public a new twist to traditional movies. Hi, my name is Rich Gregory and I am a ten year veteran of graphic arts and a cinephile (I love movies) since I was a small child.

Growing up I dreamt of creating a type of theater where talking is tolerated and where the audience plays a critical role in the fun.

What types of movies?

  • First run movies under the stars.
  • Cult classics where fans can dress up, sing along, or scream out your favorite movie quotes.
  • Great food served during the show.
  • Family movies that involve games and prizes.
  • Craft beer served.
  • Interactive text/tweeting during the movie, comments show up on the screen.

Why we need your help.

We are here on indygogo because need the equipment to start DRVN.

  • Movie Projector.
    We need a quality projector to start DRVN up the right way.

  • Inflatable Movie Screen.
    We will get (roughly) a 30'x18' screen. This will help us move between three cities in our first year.

  • Audio System PA.
    To make DRVN complete we need to purchase an audio system that will reach up to 500 people.

DRVN's Impact

Your contributions will go so far as in to helping upstate South Carolina get a new option for entertainment that the whole family can afford.

  • We plan to start in one location (Anderson, Clemson, Greenville, or Easley) and in time will expand to showing movies to different cities per month.

Please help us get the word out!

Tell everyone you know about this campaign and help us provide good things for upstate South Carolina. Befriend us on Facebook and Twitter and thanks to indiegogo for this great platform to reach people.

story:
On May 26, 2012 the world lost one os it's brightest stars, Maceo Davis.

Maceo Davis possessed true grace. He touched the hearts of every person he ever met. He brought light to a world and made people feel as if he were their best friend.

Maceo loved people, he loved life and he loved theater. To entertain was his passion. But more than all of these things, Maceo loved to help people. Helping by making someone feel loved or by encouraging someone to achieve their dream. It seems as if the purpose of Maceo's time on earth was to spread love and make people feel special.

In June of 2012, Sheila McClure and David Lollar contacted Michelle Guerrero and Eric Tolley to ask for their help in starting a production company that would keep the memory of Maceo alive by bringing the joy of theater to the masses. Michelle and Eric agreed to join them and The Dream Factory was born. But The Dream Factory is not just a production company.

The goal of each Dream Factory Production is to raise a substantial amount of money to provide scholarships in Maceo's name for High School Seniors persuing a degree in the theatre arts.

A NOTE FROM THE DIRECTOR:

In the fall of 2008, as I was fighting valley fever, trying to finish my thesis production, and figuring out how to handle being a new mommy to my 6-month old baby boy, Althea Williams called me and invited me out to dinner. Looking back, I laugh realizing how gullible I was. Here I was thinking my friend was just trying to get me out of the house, not thinking for a second she had an ulterior motive. A BCT board member A WOMAN CALLED TRUTH for this inaugural production (I’m not sure if it was Julie Jordan Scott or Althea who selected the play, but I digress). After trying to get me drunk, she told me about the idea and that, in no uncertain terms, I needed to direct the show, that I was the only person who could. It took a lot of arm-twisting, but between her and my husband, I agreed to do it. I’m eternally grateful they convinced me.

I had done KISS ME, KATE with Maceo and had seen him in numerous other productions, and told him he was the most under-utilized and under-appreciated actor in town. I didn’t have any huge roles for him in the production, but I knew I had to work with him again. I must have called him twenty times before we finally made contact. It took a lot of arm-twisting, but between my begging and flexibility of rehearsal schedule, he agreed to do it. I’m eternal grateful I convinced him.

During the production of TRUTH, I saw A RAISIN IN THE SUN immediately called Althea. I told her BCT had to do that show for next year’s Black History Month production. Of course she agreed. I then told Maceo he had to play my Walter Lee. Of course, he agreed, too. And once again, I’m eternally grateful.

Then came August Wilson’s GEM OF THE OCEAN, and once again, a year in advance, I told Althea and Maceo we had to do this show. Once again, they agreed. And once again, I’m eternally grateful. And while working on GEM, I looked at Maceo and said, “you should play Frank in ROCKY.” You know what I’m going to say next…so, yeah.

I fought Althea on A WOMAN CALLED TRUTH. I didn’t want to do it. I didn’t want to work on a show that, according the to description on the back cover of the script, was a “youth” show. I didn’t understand why my husband, who loathes giving up his free time more than getting a root canal and had less experience with babies than power tools, would gladly offer to spend 2 to 4 hours every evening for two months with our infant son while I was in rehearsal. I know now it was Divine Intervention. It was the Hand of God. It was an incredible blessing. And I am eternally grateful.

I could go on and on about Maceo’s amazing performances: his tender portrayal of Sojourner Truth’s lover, Bob, who is forced to give up Sojourner because of slavery; the power and yearning of his Walter Lee, fighting against a society that defers his dreams; his incredible combination of strength and vulnerability as Citizen Barlowe, a young man who has convicted himself of murder and can only cleanse his soul by “visiting” his ancestors and reconciling with his victim; how he made us laugh as the over-the-top Frank and made us cry when he sang “I’m Going Home.” I could go on for hours about all of the incredible performances we’ve all seen him do over the years. And I’m not exaggerating. I really could! One of my favorite things in life is watching a talented actor move an audience, and Maceo was one of my favorites. (A funny story—Maceo & I would text each other through “So You Think You Can Dance” and “American Idol” and share our colorful thoughts on each performance…so, so, so fun…I’m eternally grateful for those memories…but I digress…)

Although Maceo was crazy talented and SUCH a blessing to work with from a director’s standpoint, that’s not what I miss most about my friend and that’s not what I take from the brief time we had him here with us. More than anything else, I miss his spirit and I miss his heart. The reason he was able to play those powerful and amazing people so well is because he was powerful and amazing. He was strong and vulnerable and funny and moving and wise and yearning and loving…and he brought out the best in all of us.

I miss my friend. But I know, like Walter Lee, he’s moved to another place where he’s fulfilling some dreams he wasn’t able to fulfill here. I know, like Citizen Barlowe, he’s being celebrated by his ancestors. And I know, just as Sojourner Truth’s mother told her and as she told her children when they were torn apart long before they were ready to be parted…I know that when I look up at the stars, he’s there…putting on some freakin’ incredible shows.

And I’m eternally grateful.

~Sheila McClure

We can't do it without your help

Theatre productions cost a lot of money:

  • Although our end goal is to raise money for scholarships, our first goal is to bring the joy of theatre to people as Maceo would have wanted.
  • The money raised during this campaign will go to production costs.
  • Supporters that donate a minimum of $100 will be listed as a producer in the program and will receive 2 tickets to a regular performance.
  • Supporters who donate over $500 will be listed as a producer on all marketing materials and on the cover of the program and will receive two tickets to a regular performance, two tickets to the opening night gala performance and a signed cast photo.
  • Supporters who donate over $1000 will be will be listed as a producer on all marketing materials and on the cover of the program. They will receive four tickets to a regular performance, two tickets to the opening night gala performance, a signed cast photo, and a show t-shirt.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help, but don't have money to donate?

Please share this link, like our group on Facebook, and spread the word about Les Miserables as we get closer to opening.

Contact producer, Michell Guerrero at thedreamfactorygroup@gmail.com to join the marketing team, tech crew or to purchase tickets.

 

Thank you for all of your support.

story:
Hello, and thank you for taking this time to read about our exciting project!

My Name is Anna Sullivan, and I am the Artistic Director and Choreographer of Anna and The Annadroids, a digitally enhanced dance and aerial theater company based in San Francisco, California. We are currently raising $4,000 through Indiegogo to cover the costs of presenting our upcoming production The Clone Zone.

The Clone Zone is a video game-inspired dance and aerial show that is modeled after Carl Jung’s theory of the human psyche. Just like in a video game, the dancers progress through each level gaining and losing life along the way. The strategy of this game is to complete each level with at least one life remaining. As the characters complete each level they become more aware, ultimately achieve Collective Unconscious, and thus become more connected to a higher level of enlightened humanity. The overall message of the show is that if we as humans are willing to more deeply investigate the social pressures and personal phenomenological experiences that make us who we are, we will obtain an awareness that will help us move toward what Jung called Individuation, the individual Self who evolves from out of undifferentiated unconscious. We cannot escape our Self, but we can escape a Clone Zone way of life.

This exciting production is scheduled to premiere in San Francisco at Dance Mission Theater November 16-18, 2012. The funds raised through Indiegogo will cover theater rental ($2,800) and rehearsal space ($3,200). We recently received a grant through The Zellerbach Foundation for $2,000, which we put toward rehearsal space costs leaving us with a total of $4,000 to raise to cover our production expenses. All the funds we raise through this campaign will go toward these production costs.

Any contribution you can make toward our goal will be greatly appreciated by all the artists involved in the production. We hope to pay ourselves with the ticket revenue so having the space costs covered will help us all be compensated for our hard work.

Any donation of $5 or more will receive a personalized postcard of The Clone Zone signed by Anna and The Annadroids!

Any donation of $10 or more will receive five personalized postcards signed by Anna and The Annadroids!

Any donation of $25 or more will receive an 11x17 poster of The Cone Zone signed by Anna and The Annadroids!

Any donation of $50 or more will receive the latest Anna and The Annadroids t-shirt!

Any donation of $100 or more will receive an Anna and The Annadroids 2013 calendar!

Any donation of $1,000 or more will receive a one of a kind Annadroid action figure doll!!!

If you are unable to contribute at this time please help us spread the word about our show and company to your community! You could post our campaign on Facebook or share our webstie with your friends! We hope to tour this show in 2013 and maybe we can bring the show to you! Thanks again : )

Robotically yours,

Anna and The Annadroids
story_txt:
Hello, and thank you for taking this time to read about our exciting project! My Name is Anna Sullivan, and I am the Artistic Director and Choreographer of Anna and The Annadroids, a digitally enhanced dance and aerial theater company based in San Francisco, California. We are currently raising $4,000 through Indiegogo to cover the costs of presenting our upcoming production The Clone Zone. The Clone Zone is a video game-inspired dance and aerial show that is modeled after Carl Jung’s theory of the human psyche. Just like in a video game, the dancers progress through each level gaining and losing life along the way. The strategy of this game is to complete each level with at least one life remaining. As the characters complete each level they become more aware, ultimately achieve Collective Unconscious, and thus become more connected to a higher level of enlightened humanity. The overall message of the show is that if we as humans are willing to more deeply investigate the social pressures and personal phenomenological experiences that make us who we are, we will obtain an awareness that will help us move toward what Jung called Individuation, the individual Self who evolves from out of undifferentiated unconscious. We cannot escape our Self, but we can escape a Clone Zone way of life.This exciting production is scheduled to premiere in San Francisco at Dance Mission Theater November 16-18, 2012. The funds raised through Indiegogo will cover theater rental ($2,800) and rehearsal space ($3,200). We recently received a grant through The Zellerbach Foundation for $2,000, which we put toward rehearsal space costs leaving us with a total of $4,000 to raise to cover our production expenses. All the funds we raise through this campaign will go toward these production costs. Any contribution you can make toward our goal will be greatly appreciated by all the artists involved in the production. We hope to pay ourselves with the ticket revenue so having the space costs covered will help us all be compensated for our hard work.
Any donation of $5 or more will receive a personalized postcard of The Clone Zone signed by Anna and The Annadroids!
Any donation of $10 or more will receive five personalized postcards signed by Anna and The Annadroids! 
Any donation of $25 or more will receive an 11x17 poster of The Cone Zone signed by Anna and The Annadroids!
Any donation of $50 or more will receive the latest Anna and The Annadroids t-shirt! 
Any donation of $100 or more will receive an Anna and The Annadroids 2013 calendar! 
Any donation of $1,000 or more will receive a one of a kind Annadroid action figure doll!!!
If you are unable to contribute at this time please help us spread the word about our show and company to your community! You could post our campaign on Facebook or share our webstie with your friends! We hope to tour this show in 2013 and maybe we can bring the show to you! Thanks again : )Robotically yours, Anna and The Annadroids

story:
Cantadora Theatre was formed at East 15 Acting School. A group of like minded actors and writers all reaching towards creating cathartic, human, raw, vulnerable work which brings us all together and poses important - not impossible - questions about what it means to be alive. Fog, Vapour, Wisp is Nicholas Audsley, Leigh-Anne Gilbert, Damien Hughes, Annie McKenzie, Sally Reichardt and Emma Spearing's first devised project together, one which was born from the ancient Selkie myth. The work is bold, unafraid and visceral. We want to welcome the audience into a world of our own devising, allow them to snoop around, take in as much as they can, and leave with a fuller sense of who they are. 

We are Cantadora, we are the keepers of the old stories.

Fog, Vapour, Wisp explores the dark, light and grey hues of humanity whilst begging the fundamental questions; what happens if we lose our soul-skin and how do we get it back? Are we all wandering on a stormy cliff in the darkness? How do we find our way back home? Home. Take a deep breath, find your fur and let the soul slam through you like a sudden summer wind. After all, you are made of the sea and stars and one day you are going to find yourself again.

We will be performing in The Dark Bar at Vault Festival 2014, a space that was never intended to house productions in the first place. We took the space, in which the walls leak water and the exposed brick tell stories of a mysterious building of old and were told a few weeks later that because of licensing issues we would not be eligible for a lighting rig or sound system to be brought into the space.

This job has now fallen into to us. 

We need to fund it all: lighting, sound, props, costumes, set and marketing. We have allocated a total of £300 costumes. We have also allocated £500 for a lighting rig and £250 for a PA system to take into the space. £250 will go towards marketing. £500 will go to our set - we will be needing a large table, chairs, lamps, torches, the list goes on ... and the final £200 will be used for workshops with directors and to pay our crew.


If we don't reach our entire goal the funds will go into the project and will be used in any way they can to support the production and add to the work we hope to achieve. If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't contribute. Send this page to friends, pets, lovers, sisters, brothers, bosses and long lost rich aunties. 

Help by spreading the word. Help by getting us out there.

Your help is so appreciated, please work with us to make this project the best that it can be.

story:
Our Story

Vampire Cowboys, New York City's OBIE Award Winning geek theater company creates new works of theater based in dark comedy and stage combat with a comic book aesthetic.  Vampire Cowboys has created such fan favorites as FIGHT GIRL BATTLE WORLD, SOUL SAMURAI and, most recently, THE INEXPLICABLE REDEMPTION OF AGENT G


This season, the theatre company that the Village Voice hailed as "New York's Best Army of Geeks" returns to Off-Broadway! But before they can blow it up in midtown, they first have to visit home. The road to Theater Row goes through the Javits Center!


The Impact

Help Vampire Cowboys bring our unique brand of geek theatre back to NY ComicCon at the Javits Center in October.  Your contribution helps us to pay for our booth, and continue our marketing and outreach efforts for our upcoming Off-Broadway production of THE INEXPLICABLE REDEMPTION OF AGENT G by Qui Nguyen and the development of Crystal Skillman's GEEK and a new musical created for Vampire Cowboys, CYNTHIA & THE DREADFUL KITE by Webb Wilcoxen and Jonathan Comisar. 


What We Need & What You Get

$3000 will help us pay for our booth, the van that gets our stuff to the Javits Center, the electricity in the booth, the posters, the postcards, the stickers and all of the swag we use to promote our shows.  NY ComicCon is 80% of Vampire Cowboys' annual marketing budget and we need your help to make it happen again this year!


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a donation right now - help us spread the word about this campaign!


Or stop by our booth at ComicCon!


Or come to check out one of our amazing FREE First Bite Workshops this season!

story:
Hello! Ethikos Productions is thrilled to present our inaugural production "Israel Horovitz One-Acts: It's Called the Sugar Plum/Beirut Rocks" at the Flea Theater, July 5th - 15th. "Israel Horovitz One-Acts" is comprised of exciting, young NYC-based artists from backgrounds as varied as Harvard, Rutgers, the William Esper Studio, and Life 101. Our common aim? To produce an excellent night of theater.

Together, “Sugar Plum” and “Beirut Rocks,” mark a unique pairing of Horovitz’s work, recommended by the playwright himself. This combination is also being produced in Paris, France at the same time this year! “Sugar Plum” creates a time capsule of the late 1950’s, a sweet farce, that turns grief into a love story. “Beirut Rocks” is a shocking study in the shattering events of the Hezbollah air raids in Beirut in 2006. We plan to put these short plays side by side, for an evening of bold theatrical work across generations.

Ethikos Productions is a non-profit production company that sprung from a connection that yours truly, Brian and Jenna, found in the classroom at William Esper Studio. “Israel Horovitz One-Acts,” has all our energy, all our focus, and is our great teacher as we put up our very first production. 

This production marks the moment to take our art to new professional heights. We will be performing at the well-known and respected venue, The Flea Theater (www.theflea.org). The Flea represents the quintessential off-Broadway experience of taking risks and exploring gutsy works, new and classic. As a maverick production company, we value having our performances at a venue that truly fosters artistic integrity. Israel Horovitz, the celebrated playwright of both one-acts, will be collaborating with us on our project. Additionally, Mia Walker, currently Assistant Director of Broadway’s "The Gershwins Porgy and Bess," and former Resident Director at the Flea, will be directing both one-acts. We have an experienced technical team dedicated to enhancing the work of our talented actors.

 

 It’s in this moment that we need your help to meet our financial goals:

$3000 - Theater Rental

$1700 - Rehearsal Residency

$1200 – 50% of the Total Artist Stipends**

$1200 - Set/Props

$600   - Rights to the plays

$500   - Publicity

$400   - Liability Insurance

$400   - Flea Box Office

Total - $9,000

**The balance of the artist stipends will come from ticket sales.

 

While we value any financial contribution you can make, please know that word of mouth, sharing on Facebook, and using the Indiegogo.com share tools are also all wonderful ways to contribute. We are going "all or nothing" on Indiegogo. This means that we need to raise the full $9,000. If this goal is not reached, we will not receive any funds from the campaign.  Please help us realize this goal!

This part of our process as producers is a humbling one.  We thank you for your generosity, kindness, and good will.

All our best,

Jenna & Brian

Co-Producers

--

 

Our creative team:

Directed by Mia Walker

"Sugar Plum" cast: Jenna Ciralli, Brian Rice

"Beirut Rocks" cast: Julie Asriyan-Piotrowski, Dan Catomeris, Lyle Friedman, and Hunter Thore

Stage Manager: Nicole Greene

Dramaturg: Megan O'Keefe

Technical Director: Rachael Harris

Set Designer: Jason Sherwood

Lighting Designer: Jonathan Cottle

Assistant Lighting Designer: Jenna Lloyd

Sound Designer: Tasha Guevara

Costume Designers: ESosa and Ashley Farra

Video by Daphne Schmon

Publicist: Dane Joseph

House Manager: Natalie Engelbert

Associate Producer: John H. Kaufman III

Producers: Jenna Cirall, Brian Rice, and Jeffrey Galli

story:
Burnt Thicket Theatre in partnership with Raise Their Voice presents 
SHE HAS A NAME by Andrew Kooman 
The 2012 Tour 

A six-month tour across North America, engaging thousands in this compelling story of human trafficking.

Haunted by anguished voices, a lawyer poses as a john to build a legal case against a brothel trafficking girls into Bangkok. Can Jason win the trust of a young prostitute known only as Number 18 and convince her to risk her life to testify for the sake of justice?


In February and March 2011, SHE HAS A NAME premiered in Calgary and Red Deer to sold-out audiences and critical acclaim.  Burnt Thicket Theatre and Raise Their Voice are now partnering to take this life-changing play to cities across North America in 2012.

The $10,000 we raise here, in addition to our goal of $50,000 through Ride for Refuge will give us the seed money to contract our actors and pay our production staff—in other words, to ensure that we have the people we need to make this tour a reality.  We'll be fundraising for other elements over the next year, but without these artists, we don't have a tour.  This initial $60,000 will guarantee that the artists will be honored with a living wage for the time, talent, and passion that they put into this tour.

You can help us take the first steps toward making this tour a reality!

Check out the perks on the right-hand sidebar—there are some terrific gifts as a thank-you for your donation, including World Premiere posters autographed by the playwright, director, and cast; a limited-edition, hand-made book of poetry by playwright Andrew Kooman; and the opportunity to have Burnt Thicket Theatre or Raise Their Voice teach a workshop for you!

All donations are tax-deductible through Burnt Thicket's partner organization, Epic Ministries (charitable status # 88154 3870 RR0001).

Visit www.shehasaname.net for more information about the project or to discover other ways to support the SHE HAS A NAME 2012 Tour.

"Calgary's SHE HAS A NAME a 'heart-wrenching' hit, powerful drama... Denise Wong is simply amazing... The subject matter makes SHE HAS A NAME a difficult experience but the love and care that has gone into this production makes it a rewarding one. FOUR STARS" 
—Louis B. Hobson, Calgary Sun

"Human trafficking play gets heart behind horror... it is the portrayal by Denise Wong of someone embodying childlike innocence enslaved by fear that galvanizes the production, and gives it urgency and emotional depth." 
—Bob Clark, Calgary Herald (read full review)

See all Media coverage of the SHE HAS A NAME world premiere.

The trafficking of children is a global reality. Experts estimate that 1.2 million children are forced into some aspect of the sex trade worldwide.  While the play focuses on an imagined case in Asia where trafficking is more widespread, experts estimate that there are some 300,000 children in the US who are currently working in the sex trade.

story:
Please Support Us!

The Glory of Living by Rebecca Gilman

Set today in the rural south, The Glory of Living follows the story of Lisa, a teenage girl who runs away from her prostitute mother with an ex-con, Clint.  But Lisa's dream of a simple life never materializes; their's is one of petty crime, apathy, and murder.


Directed by Ashley Kelly Tata


Featuring: 


Hannah Sloat* as Lisa

Hardy Pinnell* as Clint

Richard Hutzler as Carl

Stacee Mandeville as Jeannette/Transcriber

Amanda Gardner as Carol

Lindsey Liberatore as Angie

Laura Heckel as Girl

Stephen James Anthony* as Steve

Chris Cornwell as Burrows/Policeman 2/Guard

 

*AEA

story:
The Arctic Circle (and a recipe for Swedish Pancakes) is...

A comedy about a woman named Elin who travels through time, space and Sweden to reexamine all her past relationships while teetering on the brink of a breakup. Unable to find what she is looking for, Elin realizes that what she finally needs to do is look inside herself for the answers she seeks.

From the award-winning Los Angeles playwright of "WAR BRIDE" and "TO THE NEW GIRL..." Klepto Theatre Workshop and the New Works Initiative at the Playwright's Lab at Hollins University, is pleased to present this hilarious new play that's bound to please audiences everywhere!

"The Arctic Circle" will run for 4 weeks in Los Angeles at Studio/Stage from Aug. 29- Sept. 22nd. It will be paired with an new absurdist comedy, "The Matador" by Robert Plowman.

Dedicated to supporting LA art, the evening will showcase several Los Angeles area artists, incorporating paintings by Jose Cisneros, music by Jonathan Price, and the talents of local actors, directors and designers.

Every Dollar Counts

Donations to this project will directly contribute to show expenses: Props, costumes, artist stipends, and set will be coming out of the money raised through this campaign.

The Impact

  • "The Arctic Circle" is a production which seeks to give equal opportunity to women in the arts. The play is written, directed, produced, and designed by female artists and give female actors of various ages strong, empowered roles.

  • Contributors to this project will be proud to know that their contribution created valuable opportunities for new work, local artists and women in theater.

  • All artists who contribute to this project, including actors, the director, playwright and designers will be paid for their time and talent.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give a dollar, we happily accept good thoughts, kind words, and shameless facebook promotion!

If you believe in the project, but cannot donate, please encourage people who can to do so! Help us create new work in LA by posting it to your social media, sending an e-blast, or just telling people to come out to the show. 

Anything you can give is greatly appreciated.

The finest print:

  • This production is co-produced by the New Works Initiative at the Playwright's Lab at Hollins University.
  • Both playwrights for this run are graduates, or current students at the Playwright's Lab at Hollins University.
  • The Arctic Circle (and a recipe for Swedish pancakes) is published through Original Works Publishing. Please see their website for daring, new plays. www.originalworksonline.com

story:
The Story:

On May 30th 2012, I became the recipient of the third annual Santa Aloi Award, presented by the Dance Centre.

The award is designed to help choreographers stage new work. Valued at $4,500, the money is provided to assist with Dancer Salaries. The award opened up a huge opportunity for myself aswell as for the community. After careful consideration and months of brainstorming, I am proud to say I have created a new full length Tap Dance show, entitled, Love.Be.Best.Free.  My show will be presented by the Scotia Bank Dance Centre this fall.

A full length show featuring Tap Dance is an ambituous project and needs outside funding to get on its feet. It is important to me to have an appropriate wood floor and live music. Part of the project has evolved into myself collaborating with  Andrea Superstien and Sharon Minemoto, in creating a few new scores for the show. There are also costuming, lighting design, set and other production costs. There have been far too many shows that have been under reheased and under funded. I want this show to be able to live past this debut presentation. I was this show to have legs, live and breath on future generations.

I am asking for your help to help my vision come to life.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Love.Be.Best.Free, is in a crucial time of it development. For the first time in a long time, audiences will be able to sit and enjoy a story told through tap dance, but I need your help.


We need at minimum, $6000. Every dollar helps. In recognition of your support, certain "perks" have been made available. With everything form of recognition, I will do my best to let you know how much you all mean to me. Words cannot express how much your help and assistance will mean to me. Through regular video updates, I hope to keep everyone in the loop, making my project, our project.

The Show

How far will we lose ourselves to find love with someone else?  LOVE.BE.BEST.FREE follows the life of a free spririted artistic man who falls for his counter part, a materilaistic woman (played by singer Andrea Superstein). Blinded by love, he seeks to join the corporate workforce to buy the affection of his new lover. Successful in attaining his goal, we begin to see his happiness unravel as he becomes merely a puppet to his lover and the routine of day to day life. Will he find the strength to set himself free? An electrifying all-male cast comprising Ryan Foley, Shay Kuebler, Johnathan Morin and Nielsen himself tells a story for our times through tap, with live music by singer/song writer Andrea Superstein and pianist Sharon Minemoto.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Talk about it!  Talk about the show and its importance to the community.  Share and watch videos, and see just how incredibly powerful this story truly is.  I can't do this without your help.
story_txt:
The Story:
On May 30th 2012, I became the recipient of the third annual Santa Aloi Award, presented by the Dance Centre.
The award is designed to help choreographers stage new work. Valued at $4,500, the money is provided to assist with Dancer Salaries. The award opened up a huge opportunity for myself aswell as for the community. After careful consideration and months of brainstorming, I am proud to say I have created a new full length Tap Dance show, entitled, Love.Be.Best.Free.  My show will be presented by the Scotia Bank Dance Centre this fall.
A full length show featuring Tap Dance is an ambituous project and needs outside funding to get on its feet. It is important to me to have an appropriate wood floor and live music. Part of the project has evolved into myself collaborating with  Andrea Superstien and Sharon Minemoto, in creating a few new scores for the show. There are also costuming, lighting design, set and other production costs. There have been far too many shows that have been under reheased and under funded. I want this show to be able to live past this debut presentation. I was this show to have legs, live and breath on future generations.
I am asking for your help to help my vision come to life.
 

What We Need & What You Get
Love.Be.Best.Free, is in a crucial time of it development. For the first time in a long time, audiences will be able to sit and enjoy a story told through tap dance, but I need your help.
We need at minimum, $6000. Every dollar helps. In recognition of your support, certain "perks" have been made available. With everything form of recognition, I will do my best to let you know how much you all mean to me. Words cannot express how much your help and assistance will mean to me. Through regular video updates, I hope to keep everyone in the loop, making my project, our project.

story:
Our Story


Founded in 2010 by Tisch Graduates Paul Bedard and Katie Palmer, THEATER IN ASYLUM suspends beliefs and moralities through visceral, emotional, and thrilling dance-theater to rigorously investigate our world and to believe again more wholly.


Our Work

 NIJINSKY IN ASYLUM (October, 2010)
 THE DEATH / MEMORY PROJECT (April, 2011)
 five IN ASYLUM (June, 2011)
 The OTHERS Project (August, 2011)
 Dance-Theater Education Intensive (September, 2011)
 Our next full-length production (November, 2011)

Our Vision

We want the world to believe again!

Our vision is to foster a world where theater is accessible, supported, and instrumental as a vibrant medium to explore and promote empathy.


Help make our vision a reality!

Our Goal

Our 2011 Season is still underway and we will produce a cabaret in August, a dance-theater intensive for high schoolers in September, and our next full-length production in November. Please support our work by donating to these projects. Any donation, big or small, is greatly appreciated and essential to the advancement of our company and to the fulfillment of our vision.


For more information on THEATER IN ASYLUM, check out our website at www.theaterinasylum.com.

 Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

“Fair is foul, and foul is fair”

We are no longer in the Scottish Isles. We’ve traveled far into the distant future underneath the earth’s surface; where amongst a network of underground tunnels lies an inhospitable wasteland. After hearing the prophecy from three witch-like mole women, a seed engulfed with power and greed imbeds itself within Macbeth's mind, prompting an uncertain and mostly likely deadly future.  

THE PRODUCTION TEAM

Hayley Cartee (Co-Director) is a native of Durham, North Carolina she made the move to New York and studied acting and directing at New York University Tisch School of the Arts. While at NYU she studied at Playwrights Horizons studio, the Experimental Theatre Wing, and The Royal Academy of Dramatic Arts while also studying Child Psychology. To keep up on her current theatrical adventures visit www.HayleyCartee.com

Aiden Dreskin (Co-Director) is an NYC-based Director, Playwright, and Sound Designer. He is a graduate of NYU's Tisch School of the Arts, where he wrote and directed a number of original plays while working towards his BFA. Recently, Aiden has been applying his talents to programs and productions of various companies around New York, including the 52nd Street Project, Believe NYC, the Playgroup Theatre, and the Brooklyn Academy of Music. For more information, or to view samples of his work, visit www.aidendreskin.com 

Properties - Barrett Law

Costumes - Leah Gallagher

Lights - Richard Platt

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If Any Productions is a Production Company excited and eager to make their debut with this thrilling  production of Macbeth. With the team being made up of recent graduates, we are calling on the artistic community to help get our first production up and running! Most of our expenses translate to our most immediate need: Rehearsal Space. In order to put on the best possible show, our team needs the support to fund usable and affordable rehearsal space. 

In addition to rehearsal space, our second largest budgetary concern is stipends for our amazing cast and crew. With the production being made up of 15(+) individuals, our goal as professional theater artists, is being able to reward our team members for their hard work. 

The remaining funds will be used for food, costumes, admin and because we're working with a minimal set, props! 

Now we're asking for all of this, but don't forget, you benefit as well! We've got some amazing perks ranging from the fun to complete VIP access about the production. Once you've contributed to If Any Productions you're an official team member! This means you'll get updates and insights not only on our most recent production, but future productions as well.

The Impact

Young artists, especially those who have just completed their education, are in the midst of establishing themselves and creating their first mark in the artistic community. In order to do so, they need our support so that they have the opportunity to succeed. 

This production of Macbeth is not only showcasing the play in a new light, but is also stretching the boundaries of your typical  production of the Scottish Play. Not only are we working with a minimal set, but through complex choreography and staging we are bringing this underground world to life with the use of flashlights and costume. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone is able to contribute through a donation, but no matter if it's a single dollar, a share on social media or word of mouth we appreciate you taking the time to view our campaign!

story:
About ZeMonk:

Let's start by introducing you to what is now ZeMonk Productions!

ZeMonk is the shiny new theater and film production company started by James Zebooker & Isabel Monk Cade. Zebooker and Monk Cade have been curating theater events for the last year, and Strange Magic is their second short play festival. 

Our Mission Statement?

ZeMonk Productions is dedicated to creating a platform for new work and fresh voices in theater and film. A platform which reflects the vibrant and diverse population of our native city of New York.

 Strange Magic

Strange Magic: A Short Play Festival is the second production by ZeMonk. 

We have curated five, fabulous, fresh plays from five, fabulous, fresh playwrights. Each play touches on the magic we encounter in our day-to-day lives, while intertwining the fantastical!

 

The Nitty Gritty

Where

The Tank Theatre @ 312 W. 36th Street

When

Thursday, August 1st @ 7PM

Friday, August 2nd @ 9PM

Saturday, August 3rd @ 7PM

 

Here's Where You Come In

As we begin to legitimize ZeMonk to curate more content, we realize that this calls for slightly larger budgets to produce these plays! We need your help to get this snowball rolling. 

Where Will The $ Go?

Putting up a play with a cast of 15 in NYC is expensive! We produced our first festival completely independently, looked at our bank accounts... and got the night sweats. This time we are asking for a little help to fund the following:

 

Rehearsal Space

In order to put up a play we must rehearse! Renting decent rehearsal space in New York costs between $15-$30 per hour. We will be rehearsing daily all of July and right up until the first night of the festival on August 1st, 2019.

 

Paying Our Cast​

We value actors and the hard work they put in. We need to compensate them for their hard work, which means we have 15 people to pay!

 

Paying Our Crew

The festival requires a stage manager, lighting designer, photographer, and videographer. These people must be paid!

 

Scenic and Prop Design

We love minimal sets (our first festival featured four ladders, five chairs, and two tables) and we will largely be drawing from the resources of The Tank, but for our next festival we are thinking bigger.

 

Playbills & Promotional Material

We design and print beautiful collectible playbills featuring our cast and creative. Printing can be expensive. We have an incredible 3 night run coming up in the 98 seat theater at The Tank, but if we pack the house (which we expect to!), we are looking at 300 playbills to print. 

 

Thank You!

We understand that there are many  campaigns, charities, and pages floating around online which are dedicated to asking for your money. But, we believe so deeply that our voice as ZeMonk Productions will offer something entertaining and meaningful to our audiences. Strange Magic is just the beginning as we jumpstart this production company, and we'd like to thank you in advance for taking the time to read about us, let alone contribute to our campaign. Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
About The Spur-Of-The-Moment Shakespeare Collective

We are a group of emerging youth artists dedicated to making the works of William Shakespeare more accessible to the public. We accomplish this by performing scenes, monologues, and choral pieces in modern spaces, often times as a part of a community benefit project.

History of Shakespeare's Briefs

Over the past year we have been running a recreational therapy program aiming to make Shakespeare accessible to those who cannot physically attend the theatre, entitled, Shakespeare's Briefs. We provided performances for over 1000 patients and clients and visited 14 wards, 10 hospitals, and 3 senior residences. Some of our past clients include SickKids, Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre, Toronto General Hospital, and the Centre for Addiction & Mental Health (CAMH).

This program is set to continue through this year in two sessions. The first session will begin May 1st and end June 30th. The second session will begin October 28thand end December 21st. We are currently fundraising for our first session!

The program uses a basis of clown and clown-doctoring to approach hospital patients, hospice clients, and senior residence members with the sensitivity and care necessary to provide a sense of relief and distraction from the everyday healing or transitional processes they may face.


Previously we have run this program on a shoe-string budget of $500.00 per session. We want to extend the reach of our services to the G.T.A. and improve our services to perform at two facilities per week, as opposed to our original once per week basis. In order to do that, we are running a series of fundraising events, including this indiegogo campaign.


Impact Of Shakespeare's Briefs

Relief

You can't take a night off from being sick or healing. We provide hospital patients, retirement home and hospice clients a distraction from their healing and transitional processes. We also empower clients by using clown-tactics in our interactive scenes, giving them with a sense of control in their environment. 


Accessibility

While most hospitals have recreational programs, accessibility is always an issue, and the amount of interaction patients or clients can receive in these programs is constantly fluctuating. 

We provide scenes, monologues, and choral pieces for one-on-one performances and interactions by performing in three mediums: Private Room Format, Open-Space Format, and Staged Format. This maintains program accessibility in all types of facilities.

By making the interactions more accessible, we are making the content more accessible. The works of William Shakespeare were written to be performed. Unfortunately, this context has been lost, so the humanity of the characters and the text are often lost. Bringing the content of William Shakespeare's plays on its feet revives that humanity and expression, making the characters and story more exciting and relatable.


Opportunity

We also provide opportunities for emerging artists. We believe in cyclical benefit solutions: Emerging artists need to perform, and Toronto communities have many needs that can be satisfied by incorporating performance opportunities. Why not use one to satisfy the other by simply sharing what we know?



What We Need

The purpose of this campaign is to cultivate roughly one half of funding for our entire budget.


Any further amounts raised through Indiegogo will go towards travel and other operating and production costs, as seen in our budget below:

Production Costs
Space  
Rehearsal $926.60
Audition (5h for 2 days) $113.00
T-shirts w/ shipping $260.09
Clown noses $22.60
Operating Costs
Honorariums  
Actors (10) $2,000
Administrators (3) $600
Travel  
Car $25.00
GO Bus $480
Total

$4,427.29


If we are unable to raise these funds, we will have to look at how we can minimize our budget requirements. We are fundraising through a combination of other means (Special events, sponsorships, etc.) to make up the other half of our budget.

...And What You Get

As a means of thanking our donors, we have arranged for 9 levels of perks, including a special invitation to one of our public performances, copies of the ensemble's repertoire, signed pictures of the ensemble, and more! Check them all out on your right hand side---------------------------------------------------------->


Other Ways You Can Help

1) Don't want to donate online? Email shakespur@gmail.com with "DONATION/SPONSORSHIP REQUEST" in the subject heading.

2) Share the campaign on your profile and join our facebook group! 

3) Tweet the campaign and follow us on twitter!

4) Share the campaign on LinkedIn! (No, we don't have a page for that yet.)

5) In Toronto? Come to one of our fundraising events (Posted once again on our facebook group)!

6) Tell all of your friends and family about us! 

7) Follow our blog or tweet our website!
