story:
Short Summary

Raven Virginia has seen the need for Calgary to host a burlesque revue with the intention of featuring emerging burlesque talent, Veteran Calgary burlesque performers as well as inviting burlesque performers from out of town to expose the burgeoning Calgary community to outside talent. The Buxom Burlesque Revue's goals are to include all members of the community and also to invite burlesque performers from out of town in order to expose the national and international communities with thriving burlesque festivals and shows to the Calgary burlesque scene. 

We need help funding the Buxom Revue show for July 28th! We are have invited April O'Peel (Vancouver), Letabby Lexington (Edmonton) and Coco Lala (Edmonton) to perform in the show.  For this special showcase, we are renting the Lunchbox Theatre to house the event. 

The July 28th Buxom Show is Hosted by the first ever Mr. Taboo- Sven Bjornsven

Staring Vancouver's April O'Peel

Featuring performances by:

Raven Virginia

The Garter Girls

Kiki Laroux

Monday Blue

Scarlet Disdain

Coco Lala

LeTabby Lexington

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need some help with start up costs. 

Venue (Lunch Box Theatre): $250/a day

Technician: $25/an hour

Total Cost of Theatre Rental: Approximately $400

Poster Design and Printing: $150

Ticket Printing: $20

Total Expenses: $575

 

Perks:

Wink- $25 

The ladies will be forever grateful. You will receive a big shout out on facebook. 

 

Tease - $50 

You will receive a pair of pasties made by LeTabby Lexington as well as a big shout out on facebook and a personal thank you letter.  

 

Shimmy - $100

You will receive a hair flower fascinator made by Raven Virginia, big facebook shout outs and a personal thank you letter.

 

Big Reveal - $250

You will receive a hair flower from Raven Virginia, pasties by Letabby Lexington and two tickets to the Buxom Revue July 28th to see the ladies in action, big facebook shout outs and a personal thank you letter. 

 

The Impact

Calgary has the opportunity to become a burlesque Capital along with Toronto, Vancouver, and Montreal. By showcasing local Calgary talent along with burlesque artists from Vancouver and Edmonton, the Buxom Revue could make this show a launch pad for international recognition in the burlesque world.

As co- founder of the Calgary Burlesque Collective, Raven Virginia has been working to bring the Calgary community together. Raven is also the co-founder and creator of the Garter Girls Burly-Q Revue School of Burlesque which fosters new burlesque talent. The Buxom Burlesque Revue will allow the members of the CBC, all Calgary troupes and burlesque students to work together! 

LeTabby Lexington and Coco Lala of Send in the Girls Burlesque in Edmonton, bring their theatrical burlesque experience to the show.  Last summer, they appeared as Catherine of Aragon and Kitty Howard in Tudor Queens: A Burlesque at the 2011 Edmonton Fringe.  Tudor Queens sold out it's entire run, including holdovers, received 5 stars and won the first ever Staff Pick of the Fringe Award. 

The evening will feature April O'Peel, from Vancouver. This comic cutie has titillated audiences in dozens of venues across Vancouver and Canada. Her sexy silly ways have launched her onto a fast track into the hearts of the Vancouver burlesque community. Proud accomplishments include dancing and choreographing for SHINE: a burlesque musical. This busty bombshell and crew brought down the house at Granville Island's Waterfront Theatre to rave reviews from critics and fans alike. For her work in SHINE, April was nominated as best gypsy at the 2009 Vancouver Ovation awards. Recipient of the 2009 Vancouver International Burlesque Festival's award for Comedic and Satirical Brilliance and voted as Vancouver's 3rd favorite comedian in the Georgia Straight's Best of 09, everyone's favourite blonde ball of fun has since returned to scene of the crime to help guide new performers into the magical world of Burlesque by co-teaching the very same intensive where she first found her start.

By bringing these talented Burlesque artists together we have the chance to grow together as artists, which would strengthen the Calgary burlesque scene and in the end create an amazing show for the audience. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us out by sharing this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. 

Come see the show July 28th at Lunchbox Theatre, 115 9 Avenue SE, Calgary Alberta
story_txt:
Short Summary
Raven Virginia has seen the need for Calgary to host a burlesque revue with the intention of featuring emerging burlesque talent, Veteran Calgary burlesque performers as well as inviting burlesque performers from out of town to expose the burgeoning Calgary community to outside talent. The Buxom Burlesque Revue's goals are to include all members of the community and also to invite burlesque performers from out of town in order to expose the national and international communities with thriving burlesque festivals and shows to the Calgary burlesque scene. 
We need help funding the Buxom Revue show for July 28th! We are have invited April O'Peel (Vancouver), Letabby Lexington (Edmonton) and Coco Lala (Edmonton) to perform in the show.  For this special showcase, we are renting the Lunchbox Theatre to house the event. 
The July 28th Buxom Show is Hosted by the first ever Mr. Taboo- Sven Bjornsven
Staring Vancouver's April O'Peel
Featuring performances by:
Raven Virginia
The Garter Girls
Kiki Laroux
Monday Blue
Scarlet Disdain
Coco Lala
LeTabby Lexington
 
 


What We Need & What You Get
We need some help with start up costs. 
Venue (Lunch Box Theatre): $250/a day
Technician: $25/an hour
Total Cost of Theatre Rental: Approximately $400
Poster Design and Printing: $150
Ticket Printing: $20
Total Expenses: $575
 
Perks:
Wink- $25 
The ladies will be forever grateful. You will receive a big shout out on facebook. 
 
Tease - $50 
You will receive a pair of pasties made by LeTabby Lexington as well as a big shout out on facebook and a personal thank you letter.  
 
Shimmy - $100
You will receive a hair flower fascinator made by Raven Virginia, big facebook shout outs and a personal thank you letter.
 
Big Reveal - $250
You will receive a hair flower from Raven Virginia, pasties by Letabby Lexington and two tickets to the Buxom Revue July 28th to see the ladies in action, big facebook shout outs and a personal thank you letter. 
 


The Impact
Calgary has the opportunity to become a burlesque Capital along with Toronto, Vancouver, and Montreal. By showcasing local Calgary talent along with burlesque artists from Vancouver and Edmonton, the Buxom Revue could make this show a launch pad for international recognition in the burlesque world.
As co- founder of the Calgary Burlesque Collective, Raven Virginia has been working to bring the Calgary community together. Raven is also the co-founder and creator of the Garter Girls Burly-Q Revue School of Burlesque which fosters new burlesque talent. The Buxom Burlesque Revue will allow the members of the CBC, all Calgary troupes and burlesque students to work together! 
LeTabby Lexington and Coco Lala of Send in the Girls Burlesque in Edmonton, bring their theatrical burlesque experience to the show.  Last summer, they appeared as Catherine of Aragon and Kitty Howard in Tudor Queens: A Burlesque at the 2011 Edmonton Fringe.  Tudor Queens sold out it's entire run, including holdovers, received 5 stars and won the first ever Staff Pick of the Fringe Award. 
The evening will feature April O'Peel, from Vancouver. This comic cutie has titillated audiences in dozens of venues across Vancouver and Canada. Her sexy silly ways have launched her onto a fast track into the hearts of the Vancouver burlesque community. Proud accomplishments include dancing and choreographing for SHINE: a burlesque musical. This busty bombshell and crew brought down the house at Granville Island's Waterfront Theatre to rave reviews from critics and fans alike. For her work in SHINE, April was nominated as best gypsy at the 2009 Vancouver Ovation awards. Recipient of the 2009 Vancouver International Burlesque Festival's award for Comedic and Satirical Brilliance and voted as Vancouver's 3rd favorite comedian in the Georgia Straight's Best of 09, everyone's favourite blonde ball of fun has since returned to scene of the crime to help guide new performers into the magical world of Burlesque by co-teaching the very same intensive where she first found her start.
By bringing these talented Burlesque artists together we have the chance to grow together as artists, which would strengthen the Calgary burlesque scene and in the end create an amazing show for the audience. 
 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please help us out by sharing this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. 
Come see the show July 28th at Lunchbox Theatre, 115 9 Avenue SE, Calgary Alberta

story:
Short Summary

The writing of CRY LOVE began in Scotland in 2015. Mostly autobiographical, based on childhood memories and the ongoing struggle of living in an imaginary world or accepting reality, the writing turned into a tangible piece of theatre through a workshop at Pearl Studios in 2016. I am so excited to say that it is now ready to be produced on the Hudson Guild Theater stage in NYC for the NYSummerfest on September 11, 15 & 16, 2018!

CRY LOVE is in need of your support! Please help us fund our musicians, cast and crew for the run of this show. As a theatre and music teacher/director for the past 30 years, I made it clear to my students that following your dreams, your creative passions, was not a waste of time.

Sharing the CRY LOVE music, the story, with an audience, is my dream. I could not do this without the support and love from my friends, family and community.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are endeavoring to raise $5,000 to help us cover the stipends for our cast and crew as well as our musicians. This money will help us book rehearsal space, acquire production insurance, and allow us to rent the necessary props, costumes and sets to bring this work to life. 
  • If you donate you'll get access to our awesome prizes, such as signed copies of our show poster by the entire cast as well as demos with all the show's songs. 
  • If we do not reach our campaign goal, funds will go back directly to our donors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you find that you can't donate, no worries! There are plenty of other ways that you can help. 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools when you do so!

story:
Why record The Moon and the Sea?

I am as proud of The Moon and the Sea as anything I've ever created.  The musical tells the story of Erin and Charlie, two musicians whose impossible love is mirrored by the Moon and the Sea.  In the staged version of this show, all the music will be played by the actors; to get there, director David Alpert and I need to present producers and theaters with the full realization of these songs.

It's been so exciting to get to workshop this show with some of the most incredible performers NYC has to offer.  This recording will feature Hannah Elless (Bright Star), Katie Thompson (Giant, so many other shows), Britton Smith (Shuffle Along), Aaron Lavigne (Spider-Man: Turn Off The Dark), and Patrick Newton (Blue Man Group), along with an awesome band (Damien Bassman and Seth Barden).  I'll sing a little, too, and play the piano.

What We Need & What You Get

Because this score is almost all acoustic, it's important for us to record in a great "live" space with a real piano.  We've booked two days at Virtue and Vice Studios in Brooklyn, NY, with the eminent Rocky Gallo engineering.

These songs won't be available for sale after this--only to stream online.  Those who donate $25 or more get automatic downloads of the entire album; $50 and up gets a physical, signed CD (and downloads).  The rest of the goodies are in the "perks" column to the right.

Even if we don't reach our goal, I'm intent on making this happen.  With your help, hopefully I won't go broke along the way.

The Impact

Great demos land productions, awards, and other workshop opportunities. When Sean Mahoney and I started out with Factory Girls, the demos really sold the show, taking it to Goodspeed, NAMT, Boston Conservatory, and others.  Those who have heard The Moon and the Sea in person have given me the encouragement I need to extend our audience by recording the songs--I'm excited to see where professional demos take this one. 

Other Ways You Can Help

As a musical theater writer who makes his living leading kids' choruses in the Bronx and coaching cross country, I am well aware that not all of us have the means to donate money.  If you're in that boat and still want to help there are a couple things we really need.  

1) Pass the link around--who knows when someone might really connect with the show?

2) Send any encouraging words... It is really scary and uncomfortable to ask people for money!

For more on the story of the show, check out creightonirons.com/The_Moon_and_the_Sea.html

One Last Bit...

I want to shout out the many people that have been involved in this project thus far.  Blake Whyte (who just had a baby!), Cedric Neal (moved to UK!) and Isaac Woofter (writing screenplays!) are featured in the above video; the list of artists who have helped grow this piece through workshops and "living room demos" is too long for this page, but their names are here.

Thank you to everyone who has brought this piece to where it is today, and to everyone who will be a part of it going forward!

story:
We are so delighted that we have reached our target. 

Thank you so much to the 39 generous individuals who contributed! 

We hope you can join us for this new family theatre and arts festival in Devon! 

23rd- 24th July 2016, Dartington Space Studios.


For more info: www.midsummerdreamsfestival.co.uk 

Tickets available at: https://www.dartington.org/whats-on


What to Expect from the Festival:

  • Family Theatre
  • Local musicians and dancing  
  • A chance to reconnect with nature in the beautiful gardens of Dartington
  • Varied programme of exciting theatre, puppetry, clowning, comedy storytelling and music
  • Something for all ages
  • Family-friendly activities and workshops 
  • A little Devonshire escape

VIDEO CREDITS:

Music Credit: Stompin at Decca by La Vie En Rose - Performing at Midsummer Dreams Festival, 23rd - 24th July 2016 at Dartington Hall Estate, Devon.

story:
Boockvor Productions is committed to producing quality, educational theater for schools while nurturing new playwrights and participating in promoting diversity in the arts.

Union Women @ Work:  Inspiration in Motion is a one-night only exclusive event celebrating union women and their contributions to the theater - specifically during 1913 when Actors Equity Union was formed.  That year the Ziegfeld Follies opened at the New Amsterdam and The Rehearsal Club, the residence immortalized in the film, Stage Door, was also created.  This production will feature three original songs written by Charlie Leipart and John Kroner -- inspiration for a fully-realized musical tentatively titled "What A Time It Was."

In this climate of NO WORK, we are CREATING OUR OWN.  We encourage YOU to give the gift that keeps on giving . . .

story:
Support the Spring Fest Fund!


2012 marks the beginning of a new phase in development and growth for Soham Dance Space. This year I am aiming to build a dynamic team of volunteers, staff, and board members who will dedicate themselves to working for this trailblazing organization. By September, I intend to formally incorporate Soham Dance Space as a not-for-profit and celebrate our 5th anniversary with special festivities and performances. In doing so, I seek to make significant strides in 2012 towards my long-term goals through expanded programming, greater presence in the community, and setting a new precedent for what to expect from Soham Dance Space in years to come. 

The upcoming "Spring Fest" on May 6th will serve as a launch pad for this ambitious agenda. It will feature an Open House, a festive event educating the public about our organization, and the Student Recital, a program for our students/families to connect with each other and celebrate the progress of the year. The plan is to make this a very exciting day for the community to gather together in the name of Indian dance, arts education, community development, and springtime fun.

For Spring Fest to succeed with its big goals, we need significant funding support, and so I earnestly request that you consider backing this initiative. The purpose of the Spring Fest Fund, which will require $9,000 in funding, is to pool the practical resources necessary to cover the costs of holding this purposeful event. By making a tax-deductible donation to the Spring Fest Fund, you will help to propel Soham Dance Space forward so that it may serve the student body and wider community in more enriching and meaningful ways.

100% of your tax-deductible contribution would help to cover the cost of the following items:

  • Venue Rental (Theater + Burnside Hall), Parking Lot Rental
  • Costume Tailoring, Fabric, Accessories, Inventory
  • Marketing
  • Food, Refreshments
  • Live Music at Open House
  • Recording/Editing of Original Music by Renowned Composers for Anjal Chande's Performance
  • Banner, Signage, Decor
  • Video Documentation, Editing, Release
  • Award Certificates & Flowers
  • Miscellaneous Event Materials
If we miraculously surpass our funding needs for this event, surplus contributions will go towards:
  • Incorporating as not-for-profit 501c3 org - filing and legal fees
  • Board development workshops (by Chicago Foundation for Women and Arts & Business Council)
  • 5th Year anniversary programs in September
  • Facility improvements at Soham Dance Space


Soham Dance Space has been gaining momentum behind the scenes, and I feel very optimistic and excited about galvanizing the community around this new endeavor, of which I hope you will be an integral part. Thank you so much for your support and positive energy! 


Let's make BIG things happen!


-Anjal

story:
Short Summary

CalArts Actors Class of 2014 is proud to present in both New York and Los Angeles stages, our showcase production! Through showcase we have the opportunity to meet industry professionals and showcase our talent. Newsweek/Daily Beast named CalArts the Number One Arts School in the United States! CalArts actors are proud to distinguish ourselves in the industry with our training, imagination, boldness and work ethic. Alumnis include Cecily Strong, Dana Gourrier, Condola Rashad, Don Cheadle, Allison Brie, and Ed Harris.  

What We Need & What You Get

In March the graduating class as a whole will travel to New York to perform our showcase, where we will get an opportunity to meet casting directors, agents, directors, producers and other industry professionals. This is a required element of our final year, that will give us an opportunity to get more exposure. Traveling, lodging, and personal expenses are going to be costly. Which is why we need your help, all 35 graduating actors need your help in supporting us through this exciting journey!

We want to raise $13,500, this will help us with our travel flight alone!

We have been fundraising all year long, and the biggest part of our fundraising will be this page, we want to express how much we appreciate all the support and love we have been given the past three or four years we have been training at CalArts. With these final few months awaiting us, we turn to those who we love and trust to come out and show your support!

Other Ways You Can Help


We understand if you are having financial troubles, but please do pass this page along to a dear family/friend! 

Much Love,

CalArts Graduating Actors 2014

story: It's a musical

story:
Our Story:

The RockAngel Cabaret is a troupe of aerial performers from all walks of life and with various apparatus specialties including silks, hoop, and hammock.  Sometimes referred to as "cirque" or "circus" style acts, we find our entertainment is perfect for events from beautiful weddings with our flying angels to corporate events with our artists creating interactive living art for the guests.  While the troupe members have their regular "day jobs", their passion is flying and entertaining.  Our vision is to create beautiful art for audiences near and far.  To do that, we need to purchase a rig that can bear the force of what we do (aerialists can generate 1,000lbs of force doing those crazy drops).  The rig will also be portable, so we can set it up and tear it down easily, and it will adjust to multiple heights so we can perform in more venues.  View our original Indiegogo Video here.

Giving Back:

We have a big heart for children and the disadvantaged, and members of the troupe can often be found volunteering their time for charitable organizations and performing for their fundraisers.  Art not only brings people together, but it also heals, so we will continue our tradition of donating performances for charities as well as working with children who may never otherwise have the chance to experience the circus arts.

Our Goal:

Our fundraising goal is $3,000 to covers the cost of having the rig built, sales tax, and shipping.  If we meet our full goal, we will also be able to purchase new pieces that will connect each apparatus to the rig.  We hope that the Indiegogo community will be inspired by our desire to bring something different to the world and help bring our vision to life!  With the help of people like you, we can make this happen!

If we raise more than our goal, we will put the excess towards costumes and/or a second rig to expand our capabilities to perform.

The Perks!

Most importantly, you will be enabling artists to perform, but wait, there's more!  We want to thank you for helping us with our dream, so we will be sharing our appreciation for your gifts with the world via media shout-outs, wearable art for you, t-shirts, and other niftty things!  Check out our updates for new perks.

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Share this page with your friends...use all those fun social media tools to get the word out!
  • Hire us for your next gathering...we'll make it an event your guests won't forget!
  • Follow us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/pages/RockAngel-Enterprises/76894663500

Thank you for your love and support!!

story:
Who Gets the Fish? by Delaney Yeager

Who Gets The Fish? is a comedic one-act about marriage, divorce, independence, and a fish in the midst of it all.

We are very excited to announce that this original one-act has been accepted into Manhattan Repertory Theatre's Winterfest 2014! The entire cast and crew is ecstatic about working on this show and, most especially, sharing it with a new audience.

Who Gets the Fish? debuted during the summer of 2012 as a part of Tea In A Big Mug's "Sweet Tea Summer Reading Series" where director Rebecca Cunningham had the ability to workshop the piece and test it's potential. Relying on the words of the audience and the experience of the cast, Who Gets the Fish? was more than ready to become a staged (blocked, costumed, propped, lit, sound-cue-ed) piece. 


Directed by Rebecca Cunningham

Produced by Ellise Lesser
Stage Manager Laura Malseed
Written by Delaney Yeager

with

Melanie Burg as Kate
Elizabeth Belonzi as Renee
& Andrew Belcher as Carver

The show runs January 28-February 1 at 9pm (approx 30 minutes long). For tickets email mrtreserve@gmail.com.

Now that the show is in the festival, we need your help... 


What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $1080 to help bring this show to its full potential. The money will go towards our actors, their costumes, our team, our props, the festival fee, and - of course - a fish. Check out our perks and please, oh please, donate if you can. Even if we do not reach our goal, every penny will still be going towards the show.

NEW PERK! For $125 you will receive a gift certificate good for four people from New York Broadway Tours! Grab this wonderful gift certificate while it is still available! www.newyorkbroadwaytours.com

"New York Broadway Tours is an interactive walking, talking, singing Broadway history show where you get the chance to be a STAR!
Come learn fun FOSSE dance moves and sing your favorite Broadway songs while learning how it all came to be in the Great White Way!"


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help us out with a couple bucks, please share this on any form of social media!

Thank you, thank you, thank you! We hope you are able to donate and come see the show, it is sure to be a blast!

story:
Short Summary

Hi there!
Chris Wright here. I'm an actor, chef, vocalist, and food author. I've been performing all of my life and love every minute of it. I'm recently unemployed and taking whatever acting gigs I can get. Times are a little tough right now and I've recently been given a huge opportunity to change my life forever. 
This campaign is to help fund my trip to Denver to compete to be the 2014 StoliGuy. I can't trust my car to get me there so the only option is to fly. 
If I am selected as one of the finalists, I then will be given the chance to fly to New York to compete In the final round. The winner receives $10,000 and a photoshoot along with the ability to further help the LGBTI community. 
With the winnings I plan to finally make my dreams come true and pursue my career full force. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need anywhere from $500-$800 dollars to get myself to the competition and back home. 
  • As a contributor, I will personally make it my goal to volunteer with any charity that is dear to your heart, or let you utilize any other of my skills; private chef, special song requests, yard work. I'll do pretty much anything. 
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, I will use the funds raised to get me as close as possible to Denver. 

The Impact

  • Helping make a boys dreams come true
  • Being able to take claim as apart of the team that made me who I'll soon become. 

Risks & Challenges

  • The economy here in New Mexico is a challenging one, I've been doing all I can to stay afloat without having to ask for help. I now realize, I can't do this alone. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please spread the word about my campaign and utilize the Indiegogo share tool for all of your social networks. 
Too many times I've let my financial situation dictate my life and force me to pass up major life changing chances. Please give this small town boy a chance to make his big city dreams come true. 
Thank you for your time. 

Chris Wright
Www.youtube.com/Chriswrightsuperstar

story:
Hi my name is Taylor Hibi, I've been dancing since i was 7years old.I took my first Hip Hop class at Freshgroove Studios when I was 10 years old and ever since then I have been addicted to dance.I recently auditioned along with over 100 other dancers for the World Hip Hop Championship held in Germany to represent Canada.Only 40 people have been selected out of over 100 and I was fortunate enough to be one of them.The Canadian National Hip Hop Team is charging each dancer $3500 CAN(includes travel/hotel and transportation) to participate in representing Canada's Team in Germany.Unfortunately I will have to raise my own funds in able to compete.The biggest Risk i'll be taking is giving up other opportunities to conquer this one.And also the risk of getting injured from long practice hours or different dance moves I may not be comfortable with.My challenges is the Must to learn and master the choreography.And even after mastering choreography I need to know how to do the dance along side people I don't really know as compared to competing with my usual dance groups that I'm comfortable with.How I will attack all these risk and challenges is by making sure that I'm always hydrated and aware of where everyone is around me to prevent injuries.I will Practice extra long on my own to be able to master what is taught to me at the scheduled practices.As for building the chemistry with my dance team I will go out of my way to make sure I'll click with these new people I will be working with for only one purpose,to represent Canada.Any donations will be very much appreciated and will help me get closer to my goal.

Thank you,

Taylor Hibi

story:
FIRST IN ENGLISH... 


2012 marks the 40th anniversary of the death of one of the most important personalities of the past century in Italy: Dino Buzzati, the Italian Kafka. To celebrate such artist, KIT brings to New York 4 of his women: Irma, Iris, Velia, Luisa.

They are 4 passionate, proud, in love, ironic and a bit mad women trapped in their respective lives. These women represent our passion, love, and madness for theater, for literature, and for our ITALIAN CULTURE. 

So, BE PASSIONATE, IN LOVE AND MAD for theater with us... GIVE THE WOMEN THE FINAL KICK to have it all: theater rental, promotion, set.

It's a 'all or nothing'... and the women like it 'all'... 

Thank you! 
KIT (aka Laura, Donatella, Janine and....)

 

POI IN ITALIANO... 


Nel 2012 cade il 40mo anniversario della morte di una delle personalita' piu' importanti del secolo scorso: Dino Buzzati, il Kafka Italiano. Per celebrare questo artista, KIT porta a New York 4 delle sue donne: Irma, Iris, Velia, Luisa.

Sono appassionate, orgogliose, innamorate, ironiche e un po' folli, intrappolate nelle loro rispettive vite. Queste donne rappresentano la nostra passione, amore e follia per il teatro, per la letteratura e per la CULTURA ITALIANA.

E allora siate APPASSIONATI, INNAMORATI E FOLLI per il teatro con e come noi... DATE ALLE DONNE L'ULTIMO SLANCIO per ottenere tutto: affitto del teatro, promozione, scenografia.

E' questione di TUTTO o NIENTE. Le donne vogliono TUTTO.

Grazie! 
KIT (Laura, Donatella, Janine e...)

story:
Welcome!

Thanks SO much for joining us on our fantastic trek to Scotland - it really does mean a huge amount to us. We are very excited about this opportunity…and a little scared.  It's a massive undertaking, but one we are totally ready for!

We need YOUR HELP to get this project off the ground, in the air, and on its way to Edinburgh!

Following a very successful run in Washington DC with additional performances in Maryland, Virginia and Missouri, we are ready to take our original comedy SINGLEMARRIEDGIRL international!

This girl has got places to go and we need YOU to help her get there!

 

“A little gem of a solo-show…don’t let it slip under your radar!” - DC Metro Theater Arts

 

About Us

Tasty Monster Productions, founded in 2011 by Heather Bagnall and Luke Tudball, is a vibrant and exciting enterprise which brings together some of the best new talent in the United States and the United Kingdom.  Through innovative theatre, cabarets, small ensemble shows and lesser known musicals, Tasty Monster brings engaging new and re-envisioned works to a broad audience while expanding the use of technology and multi-media as a tool for storytelling.

 

 

So who is this SINGLEMARRIEDGIRL?

What do you do when you’re “happily” married and yet completely alone? Anything you can think of!

SINGLEMARRIEDGIRL, an original live adaptation of the blog www.singlemarriedgirl.blogspot.com, follows the hilarious antics of Laurel Spears, a Chicago native who, finding herself at the crossroads of a dead-end marriage and a major identity crisis, decides to take herself on a date…and see what happens next.

Funny, poignant, quirky and cool, Laurel’s the girl you always thought you wanted to be…until you read her blog!

SINGLEMARRIEDGIRL is the culmination of years of work and though it is a story of personal struggle, it is also a story of universal truth. 

 

“Spears’ refreshingly candid accounting of her own neurosis and moral failings makes you hang on her every word.” – DC Theatre Scene

 

So why Edinburgh?

Edinburgh Festival Fringe is the largest arts festival in the world and has launched the careers of multitudes of artists and theatre companies, as well as musicians, composers, directors and more. We are massively proud of Tasty Monster, and of SINGLEMARRIEDGIRL, and feel that both our company and our show have international appeal.  Performing at the Fringe will allow us an international platform on which to build in the future, and help us to make our voice heard across the world.

 

“A vivid, touching, and often amusing portrait of a young woman who married before fully understanding herself.” – DC Metro Theater Arts

 

How can YOU help?

Just as it takes a ‘village to raise a child’, it takes a whole community to bring a show to the Fringe.

SINGLEMARRIEDGIRL is our child, and we would like you to be part of our community.

There are MANY expenses involved in bringing a show to the international community beyond the usual costs of production.  Travel, accommodation, insurance, marketing and publicity, rehearsal space and venue rental, to name but a few.  We will also have to rebuild the set overseas as we will not be able to bring it with us from the US.

We have budgeted this campaign based on the total expense of this production.  But should we not reach our goal, your contributions will still offset the costs and help us to bring this exciting dream to fruition.  Every dollar really does get us a step closer to the Royal Mile!

 

Check out our great PERKS and make a PLEDGE today!

story:
Short Summary

The Ann Arbor Young Actors Guild (YAG) is a non-profit educational youth theatre organization. We are dedicated to an inclusive, collaborative experience. Every young actor who auditions for a play gets a role. With no competition, YAG is a great place for local youth to make friends and learn skills no matter how much experience they have. 

Without a space of our own, we have to store all of our props and costumes in a 10'x30' storage unit using whatever we can find to organize our items. Many of our costumes and props are stored in larger props, garbage bags, or broken storage bins. Despite our attempts at organization, our unit is such a mess that it's very difficult for our volunteers to find what they need. 

It's time to try something new. This summer, we want to purchase serious organizational supplies, weed through what we don't need, and gather a team of volunteers to meticulously organize and catalog our items. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2000 to take on this project. This will allow us to pay for:

  • Shelving Units
  • Storage Bins
  • Compensation for our coordinator
  • T-shirts for volunteers
  • Miscellaneous supplies
To express our gratitude, we are offering cumulative perks. You'll receive the perk for your donation amount as well as all perks leading up to that amount. Thank you for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a financial contribution, there are other ways you can help us reach our goal:

  • Share this campaign on your social media accounts to spread the word
  • Volunteer to help clean, sort, or photograph items once work starts in August (see our website for more details)

story:
Kidd Pivot & Electric Company Theatre = Magic.

Shock and bewilderment encompass you in the wake of a disaster. In this timeless, liminal space you are the survivor, still responding to the crisis long after it has subsided. Created by Crystal Pite (Kidd Pivot) and Jonathon Young (Electric Company Theatre), Betroffenheit explores powerful themes of loss, trauma, addiction and recovery through a boundary-stretching hybrid of theatre and dance. 


About the Show

Crystal Pite and Jonathon Young. One actor and five Kidd Pivot company members. A design team of six that spans the globe.  This is a big show. A complex one. And we can't wait to bring it to you.

We are looking to raise $10 000 before our premiere on July 23, 2015 in Toronto, ON. Any funds raised in this campaign will go towards production elements as we get to the end of our rehearsal period. We're going to make fancy things. Sparkly things. Loud things. Bright things. BUT we can't tell you any more than that, because it's gotta be a surprise for when you see it live. Trust us.

Betroffenheit, cast. Photo by Wendy D Photography.

Want to see it live?

The company will be coming together in Vancouver, Canada for 4 weeks to rehearse the work. We then all go to The Banff Centre for 3 weeks of intensive technical creation, where we will have 2 in-progress showings on July 16 & 17, 2015.

We premiere in Toronto, ON, Canada (July 23 - 25, 2015). After a few months of hiatus, the show will be out on the road for FIVE months with 14 people.

We hope you'll be able to join us at one of these shows (click the city for ticket link or more info).

February 12 & 13, 2016 – Ottawa, ON National Arts Centre // NAC Dance

February 18 – 21, 2016 – Toronto, ON Canadian Stage

February 26 & 27, 2016 – Vancouver, BC DanceHouse

March 11 & 12, 2016 – Victoria, BC Dance Victoria

March 18 & 19, 2016 – Seattle, WA On the Boards // Seattle Theatre Group

March 31 – April 2, 2016 – Portland, OR White Bird

April 21 & 22, 2016 – Dallas, TX TITAS Presents

And many more to come, including the UK and Europe - we're just finalizing details and will update soon! 

All contributions received through Indiegogo will go directly to the costs of rehearsing and touring Betroffenheit. By contributing you will be helping Kidd Pivot and Electric Company Theatre to bring this phenomenal work to the stage!

Our ways of saying “thanks”!

We welcome contributions of any size – big or small, every gift will bring us closer to achieving our goal.  For a gift $25 or more you have the option to receive one of the special perks listed on this page – from personalized shout-outs to exclusive packages that include merch, photos, signed scripts, a personalized video thank-you, an invitation to a studio rehearsal, and even Skype chats with the creators! We've listed a January 2016 delivery date for some of these items, but hope to have most of 'em out by September 2015.

If you're Canadian and give a gift of $25 or more, you will get a tax receipt for the amount of your donation (minus value of perks). Hoorah!

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE

Spreading the word is another valuable way you can help Kidd Pivot and Electric Company. Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Email it to your friends! 

#Betroffenheit

KIDD PIVOT:  Facebook and Twitter 

ELECTRIC COMPANY THEATRE: Facebook and Twitter


PARTNER

Do you have a business or organization that is interested in pursing unique cultural partnerships through sponsorship contributions? Kidd Pivot and Electric Company Theatre are two of Canada's most respected performing arts innovators, and we'd love to chat with you about additional perks available for businesses and organizations.  (Give us a shout at info@kiddpivot.org for more details!)

Join these other incredible co-producers on the road to our premiere:

PANAMANIA Arts and Culture Program of the TORONTO 2015 Pan Am and Parapan Am Games, Sadler’s Wells (London, UK), On the Boards and Seattle Theatre Group through the support of Glenn Kawasaki, National Arts Centre (Ottawa), the CanDance Network, Canadian Stage (Toronto), L’Agora de la Danse (Montreal), Brian Webb Dance Company (Edmonton), and Dance Victoria (Victoria).

The Banff Centre Residencies for Betroffenheit were made possible through generous donations by The Stollery Family and Andrea Brussa.


About KIDD PIVOT

Integrating movement, original music, text, and rich visual design, Kidd Pivot’s performance work is assembled with recklessness and rigour, balancing sharp exactitude with irreverence and risk. Under the direction of internationally renowned Canadian choreographer Crystal Pite, the company’s distinct choreographic language – a breadth of movement fusing classical elements and the complexity and freedom of structured improvisation – is marked by a strong theatrical sensibility and a keen sense of wit and invention.

Crystal Pite has collaborated with celebrated dance artists, theatre companies and filmmakers in Canada, Europe, and the United States. Since 2002, she has created and performed under the banner of her own company. Her work and her company have been recognized with numerous awards and commissions, including an Olivier Award in 2015 for her work at Sadler's Wells. Kidd Pivot tours extensively around the world with productions that include The Tempest Replica (2011), The You Show (2010), Dark Matters (2009), Lost Action (2006), and Double Story (2004), created with Richard Siegal. Kidd Pivot is the recipient of the 2006 Rio Tinto Alcan Performing Arts Award, and was resident company at Künstlerhaus Mousonturm, with the support of Kulturfonds Frankfurt Rhein Main, in Frankfurt, Germany from 2010 to 2012.

“Pite is an image-maker of rare distinction.” – The Australian

“… her choreographies have their own language: mercurial and full of power and humor.” – Journal Frankfurt


About ELECTRIC COMPANY THEATRE

Electric Company Theatre is a leading force in the Canadian theatre scene: creating original work rich in spectacle and adventurous in form, strong in narrative and reaching a diverse and growing audience. The company was originally formed as a collective in 1996 by Siminovitch Prize-winning director Kim Collier, David Hudgins, Jonathon Young and Governor General’s Award-winning writer Kevin Kerr, who met while training at Vancouver’s Studio 58. Their common respect for physical theatre, spectacle, adventurous narrative, new technology and visual art inspired the creation of their first show and the company that followed. The company’s methodology has evolved but the creative process remains highly collaborative; blurring traditional boundaries between playwright, director, dramaturgy and design. 

With a growing body of work, Electric Company has created nineteen mainstage productions, toured eight times (Canada, USA, Scotland), written two screenplays, and won the first Alcan Performing Arts Award for Theatre (2001) in addition to multiple theatre awards across the country. 

"Jonathon Young is radiant.  This guy always looks like he's lit from within." – Georgia Straight

"It's no exaggeration to say that Young moves with the grace and precision of Charlie Chaplin or Buster Keaton." – Georgia Straight
story_txt:
Kidd Pivot & Electric Company Theatre = Magic.
Shock and bewilderment encompass you in the
wake of a disaster. In this timeless, liminal space you are the survivor, still
responding to the crisis long after it has subsided. Created by Crystal Pite (Kidd Pivot) and Jonathon Young (Electric Company Theatre), Betroffenheit explores powerful themes
of loss, trauma, addiction and recovery through a boundary-stretching hybrid of
theatre and dance. 



About the Show
Crystal Pite and Jonathon Young. One actor and five Kidd Pivot company members. A design team of six that spans the globe.  This is a big show. A complex one. And we can't wait to bring it to you.
We are looking to raise $10 000 before our premiere on July 23, 2015 in Toronto, ON. Any funds raised in this campaign will go towards production elements as we get to the end of our rehearsal period. We're going to make fancy things. Sparkly things. Loud things. Bright things. BUT we can't tell you any more than that, because it's gotta be a surprise for when you see it live. Trust us.



Betroffenheit, cast. Photo by Wendy D Photography.
Want to see it live?The company will be coming together in Vancouver, Canada for 4 weeks to rehearse the work. We then all go to The Banff Centre for 3 weeks of intensive technical creation, where we will have 2 in-progress showings on July 16 & 17, 2015.We premiere in Toronto, ON, Canada (July 23 - 25, 2015). After a few months of hiatus, the show will be out on the road for FIVE months with 14 people.
We hope you'll be able to join us at one of these shows (click the city for ticket link or more info).
February 12 & 13,
2016 – Ottawa, ON National
Arts Centre // NAC Dance
February 18 – 21, 2016
– Toronto, ON Canadian Stage
February 26 & 27,
2016 – Vancouver, BC DanceHouse
March 11 & 12, 2016 – Victoria, BC Dance Victoria
March 18 & 19, 2016 – Seattle, WA On the Boards // Seattle Theatre Group
March 31 – April 2, 2016
– Portland, OR White
Bird
April 21 & 22, 2016 – Dallas, TX TITAS PresentsAnd many more to come, including the UK and Europe - we're just finalizing details and will update soon! All contributions received through Indiegogo will go directly to the costs of rehearsing and touring Betroffenheit. By contributing you will be helping Kidd Pivot and Electric Company Theatre to bring this phenomenal work to the stage!Our ways of saying “thanks”!We welcome contributions of any size – big or small, every gift will bring us closer to achieving our goal.  For a gift $25 or more you have the option to receive one of the special perks listed on this page – from personalized shout-outs to exclusive packages that include merch, photos, signed scripts, a personalized video thank-you, an invitation to a studio rehearsal, and even Skype chats with the creators! We've listed a January 2016 delivery date for some of these items, but hope to have most of 'em out by September 2015.If you're Canadian and give a gift of $25 or more, you will get a tax receipt for the amount of your donation (minus value of perks). Hoorah!Other Ways You Can HelpSHARESpreading the word is another valuable way you can help Kidd Pivot and Electric Company. Share this campaign on Facebook and Twitter. Email it to your friends! #BetroffenheitKIDD PIVOT:  Facebook and Twitter ELECTRIC COMPANY THEATRE: Facebook and TwitterPARTNERDo you have a business or organization that is interested in pursing unique cultural partnerships through sponsorship contributions? Kidd Pivot and Electric Company Theatre are two of Canada's most respected performing arts innovators, and we'd love to chat with you about additional perks available for businesses and organizations.  (Give us a shout at info@kiddpivot.org for more details!)Join these other incredible co-producers on the road to our premiere:
PANAMANIA Arts and Culture Program of the TORONTO 2015 Pan Am and Parapan Am
Games, Sadler’s Wells (London, UK), On the Boards and Seattle Theatre Group
through the support of Glenn Kawasaki, National Arts Centre (Ottawa), the
CanDance Network, Canadian Stage (Toronto), L’Agora de la Danse (Montreal),
Brian Webb Dance Company (Edmonton), and Dance Victoria (Victoria).
The
Banff Centre Residencies for Betroffenheit were made possible through generous
donations by The Stollery Family and Andrea Brussa.
About KIDD PIVOTIntegrating movement, original music, text, and rich visual design, Kidd Pivot’s performance work is assembled with recklessness and rigour, balancing sharp exactitude with irreverence and risk. Under the direction of internationally renowned Canadian choreographer Crystal Pite, the company’s distinct choreographic language – a breadth of movement fusing classical elements and the complexity and freedom of structured improvisation – is marked by a strong theatrical sensibility and a keen sense of wit and invention.Crystal Pite has collaborated with celebrated dance artists, theatre companies and filmmakers in Canada, Europe, and the United States. Since 2002, she has created and performed under the banner of her own company. Her work and her company have been recognized with numerous awards and commissions, including an Olivier Award in 2015 for her work at Sadler's Wells. Kidd Pivot tours extensively around the world with productions that include The Tempest Replica (2011), The You Show (2010), Dark Matters (2009), Lost Action (2006), and Double Story (2004), created with Richard Siegal. Kidd Pivot is the recipient of the 2006 Rio Tinto Alcan Performing Arts Award, and was resident company at Künstlerhaus Mousonturm, with the support of Kulturfonds Frankfurt Rhein Main, in Frankfurt, Germany from 2010 to 2012.
“Pite is
an image-maker of rare distinction.” – The Australian

“… her
choreographies have their own language: mercurial and full of power and humor.” –
Journal Frankfurt
About ELECTRIC COMPANY THEATREElectric Company Theatre is a leading force in the Canadian theatre scene: creating original work rich in spectacle and adventurous in form, strong in narrative and reaching a diverse and growing audience. The company was originally formed as a collective in 1996 by Siminovitch Prize-winning director Kim Collier, David Hudgins, Jonathon Young and Governor General’s Award-winning writer Kevin Kerr, who met while training at Vancouver’s Studio 58. Their common respect for physical theatre, spectacle, adventurous narrative, new technology and visual art inspired the creation of their first show and the company that followed. The company’s methodology has evolved but the creative process remains highly collaborative; blurring traditional boundaries between playwright, director, dramaturgy and design. With a growing body of work, Electric Company has created nineteen mainstage productions, toured eight times (Canada, USA, Scotland), written two screenplays, and won the first Alcan Performing Arts Award for Theatre (2001) in addition to multiple theatre awards across the country. "Jonathon Young is radiant.  This guy always looks like he's lit from within." – Georgia Straight"It's no exaggeration to say that Young moves with the grace and precision of Charlie Chaplin or Buster Keaton." – Georgia Straight

story:
Who are we?

Kenopsia Productions and Blind Pug Arts Collective are two young theatre production companies based out of Washington, DC, founded in 2014 and 2013, respectively. We met while working in various capacities at Woolly Mammoth Theatre Company. We are all emerging theatre professionals with a desire to create work on our own terms and help other Millennials do the same.

What are we doing?

Fault Lines is a compilation of two one acts: The Rest, is Silence by emerging playwright Kelsey Hogan, and frag by Cornerstone Theater Company Artistic Director and Woolly Mammoth Company Member Michael John Garcés. They are two wonderful (and terrifyingly dark) plays that explore what can happen to us and our families when our psyches get pushed to the edge...

Where, when, and how much?

These performances are in the Woolly Mammoth Theatre Company Rehearsal Hall at the following dates and times:

Saturday, April 12th at 1:00pm and 6:00pm

Sunday, April 13th at 12:00pm and 4:30pm

Cost: Free!

Kenopsia Productions believes that plays should be accessible to anyone and everyone in the Washington, DC community, so we’re thrilled to invite you to enjoy a complimentary weekend of theatre.

Because of this core tenet, your generosity is even more integral to making sure that theatre in Washington can thrive.

How can you help?

To produce these plays without charging for tickets, we count on the support of our community. Can you help us raise $1,000 to ensure that new theatre will continue to flourish in our nation’s capital?

Your donations will pay to:

1. Rent the performance space at the internationally-recognized Woolly Mammoth Theatre Company

2. Light, set, and costume the productions

3. Raise awareness about these plays to make sure we have an audience

4. Give honorariums to a deeply-devoted cast and crew 

The first half of your donations will pay for the stage, production, and marketing, and the rest of your gifts will fund honorariums for the cast and crew. Any gifts you make beyond our goal will go straight to making sure the play is the highest possible quality.

Perks!

In return for your generous support, you will receive our deepest and most humble gratitude! If you’d like even more than our appreciation, you can choose from among the fabulous perks you see on your right.

What is the impact?

We have all been studying and practicing theatre for that last several years, either directing, producing, acting, or writing. As interns or hourly employees at Woolly Mammoth Theatre Company, this is our first opportunity to turn the last year's education into a fully-realized production. This experience has furthered our theatre knowledge more than we ever thought possible, and we’re so excited to show you what we’ve been working on. Your support will help guarantee that the next generation of theatre professionals will have the skills, talent, and drive to be successful. We have these fantastic new plays, a talented cast and crew, wonderfully creative designers, and the support and guidance of our supervisors at Woolly Mammoth. All we’re missing is you – can we count on you to stage this work?

Other Ways You Can Help

While we are so grateful for your financial donations, there are still other ways to support our show:

1. You can come see the show!

2. You can help us spread the word by sharing our Indiegogo campaign with your friends!

3. You can find out more about Kenopsia Productions by liking us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/KenopsiaProductions.

Questions?

Please don't hesitate to contact us at kenopsia.productions@gmail.com.

Thanks for your support!

story:
The Phenomenal Animals

Take a self-guided tour of a mysterious maze created by the sociopathic bone creatures. Skeletons rattle, acid bubbles, and a surgeon scavenges for blood. As you tour, the story of a girl undergoing an occult initiation unfolds around you. The bone creatures attempt to subdue and control the girl, but the blood creatures arrive--painted in gore--to drive them back and draw the girl into their frenzied blood ritual. Who will win the battle between bone and blood? Your initiation awaits. Will you live to tell the tale?

Our mission is to draw more people into act of performing and the art of experiencing performance. We create popular entertainment as an interactive artistic adventure. We do the performing, and the rest is up to you. Move, explore, and interact however you like. There are no walls, no boundaries, and no rules. We've spent seven years developing this unique performance style touring and giving workshops across the globe and at our home theater in Trenton, New Jersey. Our performance is your adventure. Join the story.

What We Need & What You Get

We're raising advance funds to put our new Horror House experience together: props, costumes, lights, fog, and blood. The more we raise, the better the experience we'll be able to build.

For a $25 donation, you'll be added to our list of VIPs. VIPs will receive two tickets to any showing of their choice, a drink and a snack at the door, and a private backstage tour with the actors beginning at 10:30pm any night of the performance.

The Impact

By donating and becoming one of our VIPs, you will be growing the arts in your community. The Animals are the professional wing of Odd Act Theatre Group, an arts education organization that brings theatre and performance to children in Hamilton, Lawrence, Trenton, and Princeton, New Jersey. Just as Odd Act works to share a love of live performance with the next generation, the Animals strive to bring new audiences to live art with original, artistically meaningful interpretations of popular entertainments. We're working against the culture of detachment and digitization to build and grow a community of people who gather to interact face-to-face in order to discuss the problems and issues that matter most to us as a society. Won't you join us?

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't commit to becoming one our VIPs but would still like to help, you can spread the word about our VIP program through this Indiegogo Campaign using the share tools, and spread the word about the Horror House, premiering October 11 at 8pm at Odd Act's Warehouse Theater, 200 Whitehead Rd., Hamilton, NJ.

story:
Elon’s Got Talent is an event to raise funds for Allied Churches in Alamance County. With the recent closing of the Loaves and Fishes (the only food bank in the county), all proceeds from donations will go to support Allied Churches in their mission to meet the needs of the hungry and homeless in the surrounding area. 


Homelessness and poverty is an issue that individuals and families deal with everyday. Our mission is to not only provide this shelter with the means to make improvements where they are needed, but to help serve those who depend on a food bank every week. Help us to help them, and make a difference in your community by donating to the cause. Remember that every little bit counts!

story:
We are PIGDOG, an internationally-inspired company making visually spectacular and form-bending theatre.

PIGDOG's creators Max Barton and Shawn Soh have so far worked together on two Philip Ridley plays and are developing the BLAME project, a neuroscience-inspired piece which will premiere in 2016.

We have now joined together under the banner of PIGDOG and would like to invite you to help us make our first project as a company - BOAT, by Kiran Millwood Hargrave.

Kiran is an internationally acclaimed poet and novelist. Her debut novel will be out in the UK and US in 2016, and her many poetry collections have led to her becoming a Barbican Young Poet, winning the Yeovil International Poetry prize and being published in journals and anthologies such as Room, Agenda, Magma and Bloodaxe's Raving Beauties.

BOAT is an extraordinary play about a little girl floating on an endless ocean with only the sea creatures and her twin around for company. And her twin's been asleep for a very long time.

Underneath its poetically fantastical surface, BOAT sensitively and vividly explores the mind of a child who has fallen victim to the appalling human trafficking industry which plagues our world today. The play also has a particular resonance given the current migrant crisis and the chilling images splashed across the press and social media of late. 

PIGDOG will work with sound artist Jethro Cooke to bring the play to life and provide our audiences with a strange, wonderful and unique experience. All performances will be extra-live/relaxed.

Your donations are essential in producing the play at Theatre N16 this October with our wonderful cast (to be announced imminently).

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In reaching our £3500 target, you will enable us to:

- Create our magical environment and soundscape to the highest level

- Provide a series of BSL (British sign language) interpreted performances

- Disseminate our extra-live/relaxed policy to a large range of people who will benefit from this open access approach

- Work with human trafficking charities to provide funded/reduced tickets for effected individuals

- Print and distribute Shawn's beautiful artwork, and manage a full press and publicity campaign that will bring in diverse audiences and critical responses

- Be in a position where all box office income will be split completely equally between the cast and creative team, rather than straight into the great abyss!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We have a great bunch of perks for you, including original designs, poems and music from our creative team, press night tickets and endless amounts of gratitude and love.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please help us make this important piece of work happen and be a part of PIGDOG from the very beginning.

story:
Who are we?

  • Yukar Productions launched their first appearance with an original play by Ergo entitled, "The Waiting Room" in November 2013. After numbers of actors requesting for workshops to be conducted, Ergo agreed to make it happen in May 2014. We guarantee that audience members will see each member present their efforts manifested in various forms. This showcase will feature the following talented artists from the workshop as well  rising stars and artists from Los Angeles.  

Yuka Sano

Hitomi Katayama

Tomomi Yoshida

Alpha Takahashi

Hitomi Morikawa

Yoko Kakegawa

Ryo Kenzaki

Hiro Matsunaga

Yuki Tamura

Akiko Katagiri

Director: Ergo

Stage Manager: Saori Saito

Assistant Stage Manager: Erina Taguchi 

Producer: Hiro Matsunaga, Yuki Tamura, Akiko Katagiri

  • Our campaign for the project is geared towards raising funds for the showcase in its entirety: location costs, advertisements, other necessities that staff members will encounter for the success of this production.
  • Contributions made by generous folks like YOU will support continuous efforts of artists striving to create ART in a world where life can be stressful and sometimes a bit too difficult. As entertainers, we strive to bring inspiration and hope.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We humbly ask for you generous donation to our cause and contribution in society through the arts. We will need a total of $990 in order to cover most of the costs of location fees and advertisements. Initially, each one of us participants in the showcase have contributed financially to making this event possible and we humbly ask for your additional support! 
  • When you donate $10 or more, you'll enter for FREE!!! WHAT? YES, FREE!! (Offer per donation per person)
  • Even if we do not reach our goal, your kind contributions will still be considered and taken into account for our needs to cover the cost of location and advertisements. THANK YOU from the bottom of our hearts. 

Risks & Challenges

When actors and film makers want to create something to impact the world, we have to be proactive. That's exactly what we're doing BUT nothing in the world comes free (unless we're lucky).  Workshop members have searched for locations, talked to various theatre owners, scrambled ideas and conducted numerous meetings to make this showcase happen. We've decided to use our pocket-money to initially make this happen. Our challenge is to be able to share our talent and inspiration as a service for your entertainment, and as a result, hopefully receive contributions through campaigns like this or even on site at The Complex Theatre. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support financially, thankfully there are other ways to help us! Yay! 

  • Please share our event on your social media page if you have one. 
  • Not a social media fan? Help us get the word out by sharing with people through dialogue. Word of mouth can be stronger than relying on computers and cell phones to let people know what's happening around our lives.


Location: The Complex Theatre

6476 Santa Monica Blvd. Los Angeles, CA 90038


Show dates: 

Friday, August 1st, 8pm

Saturday, August 2nd, 8pm

Sunday, August 3rd, 7pm

Entrance Fee: $5 (Free for donations over $10.)

story:
Short Summary

Throughout time, humans have been motivated by fear of eternal suffering and damnation through many iterations of this torturous neverland. Throughout these depictions, the movement has been at the forefront of these images within movies, texts, and paintings.  We see convulsing bodies, contorted spines, necks moving in the delight of rapture, and ritualistic ceremony represented by swaying bodies. The body represents a playground for the devil and movement being his game. 

C-LS has been in the creative process of their latest evening-length experimental performance, HELL, for over a year. In addition to the performance, C-LS has been in the process of creating a separate screen dance film under the same title. Club Shamoun is an interdisciplinary performance art company that works with artists across all mediums, including film, dance, theatre, music, and visual, to create innovatively thought-provoking works. HELL is set to premiere by Winter 2022, and the film release and live premiere in the Fall of 2022. In addition to choreographic direction by Lydia Shamoun, Hell will include live music by Ruby Dunphy, Visuals by Sierra Hendrix. The film is under the direction of Lydia Shamoun, Sierra Hendrix, and Allison Burke. 

What We Need 

Club Shamoun is an independent company, with most of the funding coming from the Artistic Director directly. There are several items we will need financial assistance to support:

  • NYC Venue Fees
  • Lighting Rentals
  • Artists Fees
  • Travel Costs for out of state artists
  • Production Studio Rental
  • Camera and Lighting Rental
  • Film Editing Residency 
  • Rehearsal Space

The Impact

C-LS is a small, independent company led by a woman of color who recognizes a lack of finances due to wealth disparity. Over the last 4 years, Club Shamoun has been dedicated to creating accessible, inclusive performances and creative workshops nationwide. We have always offered low-cost or zero-cost options for performances and workshops because we believe performance and art education isn’t a privilege - it’s a right. Performance breeds community, and we want everyone to have the ability to be part of that community. 

By funding this work, you are not only “giving us money for fees,” you are actually:

  • Allowing us low cost/no cost ticket options
  • Supporting BIPOC woman-led dance companies
  • Becoming part of a community that values art over profit
  • Recognizing the lack of resources for BIPOC artists and are actively countering that through a personal donation

 

SHARE WITH YOUR FRIENDS! Please share this campaign with friends, follow @clubshamoun on Instagram, and come to our show!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Throughout time, humans have been motivated by fear of eternal suffering and damnation through many iterations of this torturous neverland. Throughout these depictions, the movement has been at the forefront of these images within movies, texts, and paintings.  We see convulsing bodies, contorted spines, necks moving in the delight of rapture, and ritualistic ceremony represented by swaying bodies. The body represents a playground for the devil and movement being his game. 
C-LS has been in the creative process of their latest evening-length experimental performance, HELL, for over a year. In addition to the performance, C-LS has been in the process of creating a separate screen dance film under the same title. Club Shamoun is an interdisciplinary performance art company that works with artists across all mediums, including film, dance, theatre, music, and visual, to create innovatively thought-provoking works. HELL is set to premiere by Winter 2022, and the film release and live premiere in the Fall of 2022. In addition to choreographic direction by Lydia Shamoun, Hell will include live music by Ruby Dunphy, Visuals by Sierra Hendrix. The film is under the direction of Lydia Shamoun, Sierra Hendrix, and Allison Burke. 

What We Need

NYC Venue Fees

Artists Fees
Travel Costs for out of state artists

Camera and Lighting Rental

story:
Circles V: I AM ART

presented by Unyted Stylz Productions


A Variety Show Celebrating the Arts in Boston.

Unyted Stylz Productions, run by founder and owner Ricardo Foster Jr., is a dance company whose mission is to bridge the gaps between all styles of dance disciplines and techniques, to create events and performances that highlight all the different aspects of the arts and to entertain and educate the public with and of the arts in a way no one else has.

With this mission in mind, Unyted Stylz is seeking to put on its fifth installment of Circles, a variety show showcasing many of Boston's greatest talents, and we cannot do that without your help!  While we will be highlighting Unyted Stylz Productions' own dance crews, US Crew, Street HyPE and Contemporarily Out of Order, we will also be highlighting other singers, dancers, photographers, painters & DJs throughout the course of our show.  
Your contribution will allow us to provide participating artists the freedom to create and share their art without the cost or criteria that so many other platforms require and the opportunity to share their passion and vision with others.  

What We Need:

$3000, in a hurry!  A production of this quality and size requires significant funding.  The $3000 we are looking to raise will be allocated to:
  • renting rehearsal space
  • the cost of the venue (Boston University's Dance Theatre)
  • lighting
  • sound
  • photography
  • videography
  • programs

What You Get:

We want you to know how much we appreciate your contributions!  Without you, our show wouldn't be possible, so we'd like to show our thanks by giving back to those who donate!  With a donation of:
  • $50 = a ticket to the show (value of $25)
  • $100 = ticket to the show (value of $25) and a Circles V: I AM ART t-shirt
  • $150 = a ticket to the show (value of $25), Circles V: I AM ART t-shirt and a DVD of the show
  • $250 = 2 tickets to the show (value of $50), a Circles V: I AM ART t-shirt and a DVD of the show
  • $350 = 2 tickets to the show (value of $50) AND members of USP will travel to you and either teach a master class or perform for your event!

Why This Show?  Why Now?

Circles V: I AM ART embraces the fact that every individual's vision and passion enhances their art and makes them and it unique.  This show gives participating artists the freedom to create and share their art without the cost or criteria that so many other platforms require. 

The show will help all participants gain publicity in and around Boston and will help create a buzz about the Boston dance scene, which is little-known around the country.

Should profit be made from the show, it will go directly towards paying for rental space for rehearsals which is upwards of $10,000/year!

    Risks & Challenges

    As you can see from the title of the show, Circles V: I AM ART, we have been able to put on 4 prior successful productions of Circles beginning in 2009.  However, when putting on the show became cost-prohibitive last year, we were forced to forego producing our fifth annual show.  We are hoping that with your help, we can continue our tradition of offering Boston-area performers a free stage on which to perform and from which to reach a broader audience.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you believe in our project and our company, but do not have the means to contribute to our campaign, please help us spread the word by sharing our project on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/pages/Unyted-Stylz-Pro...) and visit our website (www.unytedstylzproductions.com) to find out where you can come take class from our dancers and how to buy tickets to the show!  We hope to see you there!

story:
**Update 2/5 -Bradley Foster Smith joins the cast in the role of "Guitar"! We welcome Bradley to the project and look forward to all he will bring to the role.

 After several successful productions of, "The Santaland Diaries", and an equally successful (but hotly contested) run and tour of, "My Princess Bride", longtime DC collaborators, Joe Brack and Matty Griffiths, are back with a brand new play, DON'T DIE IN THE DARK. 
Our play in one act, is looking to make it's world premiere in DC in April 2015, but we are currently without a home. The venues who have so generously housed our previous productions are unfortunately, well, soon to be condos. 
April 14, 1865 - John Wilkes Booth fires a single shot Derringer into history. DON'T DIE IN THE DARK, sheds light on the personal and patriotic motivations behind one of America's most shocking acts of terror, the assassination of Abraham Lincoln and the man attempting to preserve the wrong side of history. Our production explores Booth's surrendering of fame for infamy, trading family for country, and his attempt to balance stage and reality. 
Our necessity in finding an immediate home is to commemorate the legacy of the Great Emancipator on the 150th anniversary of Booth's heinous act. 
Every dollar raised of our $13,000.00 campaign will go directly to securing and building a venue and stage for our production. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to expand, beyond the pages of our textbooks, this tragic chapter in our  American history.
PERKS, how can we thank you for helping us?!? Here is how:
- For every $50.00 donation you will receive a production poster signed by the cast and crew.
- For every $100.00 donation you will receive a ticket for opening night with VIP reception.
- For every $500.00 donation you will receive an original piece of pen & ink show art, drawn and signed by playwright and performer Joe Brack.
- For every $1,000.00 donation you will receive all of the above and two pair of tickets to our 2015 production of, "The Santaland Diaries".
Like every artistic endeavor we succeed by word of mouth. Whether you are able to donate or not, you can still help by sharing this page. Every donation, big or small, will help.
Please give, share, and thank you,
Joe and Matty.
